She dreams to have a very prosperous business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Tubehoneza Sub Group B

texts.en: Godelive is a group leader; aged 32 years.She is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 12 years. The group is called TUBEHONEZA means “GOOD LIVING” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She foodstuffs and has been running in a business for 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more banana,cassava and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more banana,cassava and maize for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary W. was born 45 years ago. She is married and has four children. She is a dedicated member of the Catholic Church. She is a farmer and grows tea, vegetables, beans, maize, coffee and she has dairy cows. Every month she is able to sell her farm produce of about USD125 from sale of milk, vegetables and tea leaves. Her income is not enough to meet all her family needs, therefore, she is would like to take a loan to supplement her current earnings.  She wants to buy chicken and goat manure to increase land productivity. Also she will be able to maintain her animals by buying Dairy feeds to possibly increase milk production. She believes the loan will increase out put and this will lead to improved earnings and later change the standard of living.

loans.use: Mary wants to buy manure, animal feeds and agrochemicals

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en: Zohra is an IDP from Agdam district, occupied by armenian forces. She fled to Baku in 1993. She started her business in 2000 with her own money. In 2004 she borrowed three loans from Normicro Baku branch totaling $1400. Now she would like to borrow $1000.

loans.use: To increase business goods

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en: At twenty nine years old, Susitina is just starting her family.  She has a one year old daughter and a husband who works part-time as a taxi driver.  Besides having good baking skills, she recently started an elei printing business (a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics) using a small loan from the SPBD microfinance program. Her business is steadily growing and she is planning to expand it by purchasing more textiles and additional stencils to increase the variety of her designs. She is looking forward to a time when she becomes really successful with her elei printing business so she can also invest in her other passion – baking.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials (stencils, paint, glitters) for her elei printing business

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is an enterprising young woman with a great desire to better her situation. She is a single mother with a four year old child. Four years ago, she decided to open her own business in order to earn an income while still having time for her son. Drawing on her knowledge of work as a beautician, she prepared a small space in her home as a beauty parlor. Little by little she has become know amongst her neighbors for her good service, and this has helped to gain additional clients.

She now asking for a $550 loan to expand her beauty parlor. She will use the loan to pay to remodel and to purchase supplies that she uses for hairdressing. She has agreed to pay the loan in 6 months. You can help Maria to do great things by giving this business the boost that it needs to continue growing. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe es una joven emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación, ella es madre soltera de un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso y disponer de tiempo para no descuidar a su hijo, ella inició su propio negocio hace cuatro años, aprovechando los conocimientos que tiene de estilista, acondicionó un pequeño lugar en su casa para acondicionarlo como estética. Poco a poco fue dándose a conocer entre sus vecinos y la buena calidad de servicio que ofrece la ha ayudado a mejora continuamente e incrementar sus clientes.

Ahora necesita ampliar su local para lo que solicita un préstamo de $550 dólares que, además de la remodelación, empelará en la compra de insumos que utiliza en su estética, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Mari puede hacer grandes cosas, decídete a darle el impulso que necesita este negocio para continuar creciendo, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Remodeling and purchase of supplies

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Ivonne B. manufactures cabinetry and other furniture. Her shop is located at the rear of her home. She tends to clients from eight in the morning to six in the afternoon. She manufactures chests of drawers in laurelwood and pine. She has five years of experience in this business and works alongside her husband.

Purpose of the Loan

She would use the loan to buy more lumber. The demand for chests of drawers has increased, and she would like to meet client orders. Her funiture is well finished, and the demand is growing.

About the Applicant

Our friend Ivonne is 33. She has three children, who attend school. Her husband helps her in the business, and she would like the loan in order to meet client orders and expand her business. In addition to her cabinetry business, she runs a small store where she sells household supplies, and she would use part of the loan to stock the store with more staples. Her one-story house is of cane and has an earthen floor. Ivonne told us that her dream is to increase her business and build a more secure cement block house for her family and business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Ivonne tiene taller de ebanistería. Ubicado en su domicilio en la parte de atrás de la casa. Su atención a los clientes es de 8: AM a 18: PM labora todos los días de la semana. Su producción es elaborar cómodas, en madera de laurel y pino. Su experiencia es desde hace 5 años. Trabaja junto con su esposo.

Uso del Préstamo

Ivonne solicita crédito para comprar mas madera. Su demanda de cómodas ha crecido y necesita cumplir con sus clientes. Sus productos tienen un buen acabado por lo que le están solicitando mas cómodas.

Información Personal

Nuestra amiga Ivonne tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, ellos están estudiando. Su esposo la ayuda en el negocio e indica que le gustaría mucho que sea considerada con un crédito. Para así de esta manera cumplir con sus clientes y poder seguir creciendo con su negocio. Adicional a este negocio de Ebanistería Ivonne posee una pequeña Tienda donde vende víveres y también necesita invertir para surtirla con más productos. Su casa es de caña y tiene piso de tierra. Ivonne nos dice que su sueño es incrementar mas sus negocios y de esta manera poder construir su vivienda de cemento para dar mayor seguridad a su familia y negocio.

loans.use: To buy lumber

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: I am 39 years old and married with one child. My husband used to work for one of the government department in the town area. Unfortunately, when he got sick of asthma, he resigned from his job. We have struggled so hard to find a better life not only for us, but for our child as well. We have saved over the years, and we bought a taxi.  I drive during the week days, but on the weekends my younger brother drives. This is my first loan with SPBD and I am confident that my business will do well in future.

loans.use: To buy parts for her taxi

loans.name: Khakverdi

texts.en: Khakverdi Q. is a 46 years old farmer who keeps a sheep herd in a  small southern village of Azerbaijan. He has twelve years of experience in animal breeding and sales. He sells sheep to the local bazaar traders for meat production. He is married and has two children. Everything is going well in his business and it brings him good enough money to keep his family in good condition. However to keep animals in a good herd is impossible because of the shortage of income. Khakverdi has applied for a 1200 USD loan. He is going to expand his sheep herd and purchase 15 sheep for estimated price 60 USD each, and for the rest of the amount, 300 USD, he will build a good shed to keep the  animals safe and warm during the  winter season.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and build a sheep shed

loans.name: Alimahmad

texts.ru:
Alimahmad I. is 46 years old, has completed high school, is married, has five children. Alimahmad is planning to use his loan to buy cattle and feed for fattening. Mr. I. has been doing this type of activity for the last 13 years. After completing fattening he will sell the cattle every 40-45 days and use the money he makes from sales to purchase more animals. The main buyers of his cattle are the citizens of the city Kurgan-Tyube and surrounding regions. This type of activity is the main source of income for the family. The client is planning to return the loan within the next 12 month.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Ибрагимов Алимахмад, возраст – 46 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. На полученный кредит Алимахмад хочет приобрести крупный рогатый скот и корм для его откорма. Этим видом деятельности он заниается уже в течение 13 лет. После откорма скота через каждые 40-45 он будет продавать их и на вырученные деньги приобретать новый молодняк. Основными его покупателями являются жители города Курган-Тюбе и близлежащих районов. Этот вид деятельности является основным источникам полученя дохода для содержания семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of calves and feed for fattening of cattle

loans.name: Judy

texts.es:
Judy belongs to the local bank Las Mercedes. She works making recycled cardboard tubes that are used to make fireworks. Her business is located in the district and province of Carhuaz, in the Ancash department. With a loan in the amount of 1,500 Peruvian sols, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a master roll and a bag of powder to make fireworks. Judy is 48 years old, married, and works with her husband. They have 3 children, and both Judy and her husband work to provide them an education.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Judy pertenece al banco comunal Las Mercedes. Se dedica a la producción de tubos de cartón reciclado para ser utilizados en la pirotecnia (producción de juegos artificiales). El negocio está ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será pagará en 6 meses, comprará un rollo de guía y una bolsa de pólvora para la producción de juegos artificiales. Judy tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo. Tienen 3 hijos y tanto Judy como su esposo trabajan para educarlos.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Señora Nelly is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Valientes (Valiant Women) located at Jr La Habana Mz G Lt. 6 in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 68 years old, has nine children, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a business of buying and selling clothes.

Presently she continues selling second-hand clothing and with the earnings that she has obtained, she bought a motorcart that is driven by her son. In her business, she has to travel constantly to the residents living on the banks of the Ucayali river. With the help of her kids, she gets the physical labor done and they also help her at home.

With the loan of 1200 Soles, which she will pay back in five months, she will invest in second-hand clothes, sandals, shoes, and beauty accessories.

Nelly, despite her age and being in a little bit of bad health, continues working because she says that she has some energy and that it makes her feel more alive. It gives her a lot of pleasure and satisfaction to make the trips for her business, because she knows many places and people.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Nelly pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, ubicado en el Jr. La Habana Mz. G Lt. 6, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 68 años, 9 hijos y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en un negocio de compra y venta de ropa.

En la actualidad sigue vendiendo ropa de segunda y con las ganancias obtenidas compró un motocarro, que es manejado por su hijo, por cosas de su negocio tiene que viajar constantemente a los caseríos del las riberas del rió Ucayali. Con la ayuda de sus hijos realiza esa faena y también la ayudan en la casa.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa de segunda mano, sandalias, zapatos y accesorios de belleza.

Nelly, a pesar de su edad y estando un poco mal de salud, continúa trabajando por que dice que tiene energías para rato y eso la hace sentirse mas viva. Le da mucho placer y satisfacciones los viajes que realiza porque conoce mas lugares y personas.

loans.use: second-hand clothes and other products

loans.name: Paulina's Group

texts.es:
For 2, 5, and 3 years respectively Ruth, Flor and Paulina have belonged to the communal bank "Ccatarisun," a Quechua expression that means "Let's Move Up."

Ruth is a single mother of a four-year-old daughter; she is 23 years old. Ruth is a computer technician, and she also sells groceries out of her home. Ruth occasionally works at a business selling computers.

Flor is a single mother of two children, and is 32 years old. Flor has a bar in her home, an activity that she has performed for a year. Also, Flor sells cosmetics by catalog. With this loan, Flor will make a down payment on a mototaxi.

Paulina is married, 50 years old, and has five children, three of whom live with her. A nurse by profession, Paulina sells clothing and shoes on credit to her friends and family, products that she brings from the city of Lima. Paulina also sells cosmetics and jewelry from cosmetics. Paulina will use the loan to open a phone center.

Ruth, Flor and Paulina need loans for 600, 1500 and 1000 soles ($1125 total), money they will invest in purchasing soft drinks, noodles, sugar, vegetable, and in making down payments for a motor taxi and a phone center.

Ruth, Flor, and Paulina dream of having a computer sales business, a wholesale grocery store, of purchasing a car, and that their children will grow up to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Ruth, Flor y Paulina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa “Levantémonos” en quechua, hace 2, 5 , 3 años respectivamente.

Ruth es madre soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hija de 4 años, Ruth es técnica en computación, Ruth tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Además Ruth trabaja eventualmente en empresas de venta de computadoras.

Por otro lado Flor es madre soltera, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Flor tiene un bar en su casa, actividad que realiza hace 1 año. Además Flor vende cosméticos por catálogo. Flor con el préstamo que obtendrá pagará la inicial de una mototaxi.

Mientras que Paulina es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella, de profesión enfermera, Paulina vende zapatos y ropa a crédito a amigos y familiares, sus productos los trae de la ciudad de Lima. Además Paulina vende cosméticos, joyas por catálogos. Paulina con el préstamo que obtendrá abrirá un locutorio.

Ruth, Flor y Paulina necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1500 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, fideo, azúcar, verduras, para la inicial de su mototaxi y locutorio.

Los sueños de Ruth, Flor y Paulina son tener una empresa de venta de computadoras, una tienda de abarrotes por mayor, comprar un carro y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries, and down payments on a motor taxi and phone center.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria is divorced and has 2 children. She started the business to get extra income to pay for her children's schooling because she couldn't count on her husband to pay for it. She was unemployed and unable to count on financial help from anyone else so she decided to start her own business to meet household expenses. She began a little more than a year ago with a rented food stand outside her house that she now owns.

Maria is applying for a US$250 loan, to be repaid in 3 months, to buy supplies and new utensils. With your help, she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María del Carmen es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos. Inició el negocio para conseguir ingresos extras para pagar los estudios de sus hijos ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo. Se encontraba desempleada y no contaba con apoyo financiero de nadie por lo que decido iniciar su propio negocio para poder conseguir ingresos y sacar adelante los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace un poco más de un año con un puesto de comidas que rentaba afuera de su casa y actualmente ya es suyo.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses necesita para comprar mercancía y utensilios nuevos. Con tu apoyo podrá seguir adelante.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Yasemeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasemeen B., wife of Mr. I., is a mother of four daughters. Yasmeen and her husband have a business where they embroider and stitch clothes. Their monthly income is $100. Yasmeen would like apply for a loan to buy one more sewing machine and train her girls.

Her loan group includes: Naseem B. and Bilquis B. want to start a seasonal wheat business; Zubaida B. wants to buy a goat; Hanifan B. wants to start milk business. This is a loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mahinou

texts.fr: Mrs. Mahinou D. was born around 1970 and lives in Enagnon, a slum neighborhood of Cotonou. Married to Houinsavi Akpovo, a carpenter, she is the mother of his three children of whom two are in school and the third is an apprentice. Having lived in this neighborhood for 7 years, she sells smoked fish, jewelry, and various other products. On October 10, 2006 she came in and requested a first loan of US$ 75 which allowed her to take care of some financial difficulties with her business. She has made a lot of progress with her little business and for her fourth loan, she is requesting the amount of US$ 250 to bolster her capital which is somewhat improved at present. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerDame D. Mahinou est née vers les années 1970 et réside à ENAGNON un quartier bidonville de Cotonou. Mariée  à AKPOVO Houinsavi, menuisier de son état, elle a eu avec ce dernier trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés et le troisième en apprentissage. Installée dans ce quartier depuis sept ans, elle vend du poisson fumé, des bijoux et des produits divers. Le 10 octobre 2006, elle vint faire pour un premier prêt la demande d’un montant de 30.000fcfa qui lui a permis de régler quelques difficultés financières qu’elle avait dans l'exercice de ses activités. Elle a beaucoup évolué dans son petit commerce et pour son quatrième prêt, elle sollicite un montant de 100.000fcfa pour renforcer son capital qui s’est quelque peu amélioré.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 cases of fishAchat de 10 cartons de poissons.

loans.name: Thi Phuong Nam's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Phuong Nam (ID Number 09050003), 26 years old, is a kindergarten teacher. However, as a hardworking woman, she also performs agricultural tasks, raises chickens and tailors clothes at home. Her husband sells decorative plants for a living. She has already repaid fully the first loan. This time, she would like to borrow 3,808,000VND to invest in raising chickens and selling decorative plants. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thuat (ID Number 09050001), borrows 3,360,000VND to purchase more pigs to breed
  • Mrs. D. Thi Thao (ID Number 09050005), borrows 3,360,000VND to purchase more pigs to breed
  • Mrs. N. Thi Tho (ID Number 09050004), borrows 3,360,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thu (ID Number 09050002), borrows 2,006,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mrs. N. Thi Tan (ID Number 09050085), borrows 2,006,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mrs. N. Thi Luong (ID Number 09050087), borrows 2,006,000VND to raise livestock

    • The total amount requested is 1,200USD

    Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương Nam (MS: 09050003), năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị vừa là giáo viên mầm non nhưng chị khá chăm chỉ làm thêm ruộng, chăn nuôi gà và máy khâu tại nhà… Chồng chị bán cây cảnh. Chị đã hoàn trả tốt chu kỳ I. Nay vay 3.808.000 VND để bổ sung vốn nuôi gà, buôn cây cảnh.

    Trong nhóm chị còn có:

  • Chị Ngô Thị Luật (MS: 09050001), vay 3.360.000 VND để mua lợn giống.
  • Chị Đỗ Thị Thạo (MS: 09050005), vay 3.360.000 VND để mua lợn giống.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Thơ (MS: 09050004), vay 3.360.000 VND để mua cám lợn.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Thu (MS: 09050002), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Tân (MS: 09050085), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • Chị Ngô Thị Lương (MS: 09050087), vay 2.006.000 VND để phát triển chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Chacheni

texts.en:
28-year-old Chacheni has been selling coconuts and oil since 2004. She works at her business each day, earning a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Chacheni now hopes for a loan to buy more coconuts and oil for her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and oil for her business.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Primer prestamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=31732

Epifania es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria. Epifania es separada, tiene 40 años y 6 hijos, Epifania viaja a la ferias de la región como Putaja, Rancha, Niñobamba, de donde compra animales como carnero, gallina, cuy, los cuales son beneficiados en su casa y lo vende en la selva ayacuchana a donde viaja los días viernes y regresa los días domingos, de la selva compra frutas que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en algunas oportunidades también lleva sus productos a la ciudad de Lima. Además Epifania tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes ubicado en su casa.

Epifania necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado caprino, porcino y gallina. Los sueños de Epifania son educar a sus hijos, tener una tienda estable en la selva ayacuchana y construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=31732 Epifania is a member of the Community Bank Virgen Maria (‘The Virgin Mary’). Epifania is separated from her husband, she is 40 years old, and she has 6 children. Epifania travels to the markets in regions like Putaja, Rancha, Niñobamba, where she buys animals like rams, chickens, and guinea pigs, which are beneficial to her house and which she sells in the Ayacuchana jungle, where she travels on Fridays and returns from on Sundays. In the jungle she buys fruits that she sells in the food markets in the city of Ayacucho. Occasionally she also takes her products to the city of Lima. Also, Epifania has a small store of snacks located in her home. Epifania needs a loan of 1200 soles, money which she would invest in the purchase of livestock including goats, pigs, and chickens. Epifania’s dreams are to educate her children, to have an established store in the Ayacuchana jungle, and to build her house of sound material.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Epifania needs a loan of 1200 soles, money which she would invest in the purchase of livestock including goats, pigs, and chickens.

loans.name: Janina

texts.es: Janina, de 23 años, tiene a su hija de dos añitos, de nombre Pamela, desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de golosinas, su esposo Delmer la apoya  en todas sus aspiraciones, él trabaja como pintor de carros. Adicionalmente, Janina vende productos de belleza de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional, todo esto lo hace por su hija a quien la ama mucho y solo espera que no le falte nada, que pase lo que pase en el futuro, ella la seguirá apoyando. Janina quiere incrementar su venta de golosinas y construir posteriormente su bodega, tiene muchas ideas de negocio, y para eso necesariamente estima de un capital que levantará sus ganas de seguir adelante. Apoyemos a esta joven madre que con esfuerzo y ahínco sigue dándole duro al trabajo, solo por prosperar, ella no te defraudara.
texts.en:
Janina is 23 years old and has a two-year-old daughter, Pamela. For a long time she has made a living selling snacks. Her husband, Delmer, supports her in all her goals. He paints cars for a living. Along with her snack business, Janina also sells beauty products from a cosmetic line well known in her country. She does all this for her little daughter, whom she loves very much and hopes she never lacks anything. May whatever happen in the future happen, but she will always support her daughter. Janina wants to increase her snack sales and later build a convenience store. She has many business ideas, and to carry them out she's requesting a loan to help her increase her earnings and make headway. Let's support this young mother who works with effort and zeal so she and her family can prosper. She will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase number of snacks she sells and also purchase more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.vi: Chị Vũ Thị Hương 37 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1997. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương gia đình chị còn rất khó khăn do thiếu vốn để làm ăn. Hoàn cảnh gia đình chị gặp nhiều éo le chồng mất sớm một mình chị nuôi 2 con nhỏ. Vượt qua số phận chị đã tham gia Quỹ vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ chị đều đầu tư vốn vào làm Hương, gia đình chị đã có nhiều năm làm nghề hương nên hầu hết các khách hàng của chị đều là khách hàng quen thuộc. Bình quân thu nhập của gia đình chị là 3.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 10.000.000đ mua nguyên vật liệu làm hương
texts.en:
Ms. V. Thi Huong is 37 yrs old, and joined the TYM fund in 1997. Before joining the fund, her family was having a difficult time and did not have any capital to start any kind of business. Her life circumstances were troublesome; her husband died at an early age so she had to raise their 2 small children alone. To overcome her fate, she joined the fund to borrow money to improve her economic situation. She invested the prior loans in a business making incense. After many years in this business, she has many repeated customers. Average income for her family is 210 USD per month. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to purchase supplies for making incense.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de 2 niños que estudian, vive junto a su conviviente quien siempre está de acuerdo con sus objetivos. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas (galletas, caramelos, chicles, entre otras variedades), en las afueras de su domicilio, esto lo viene realizando desde hace un año, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer a mucha gente y dar una buena atención a sus consumidores. Le es rentable porque su negocio se encuentra ubicado en un buen lugar que es muy transitable y concurrido, le va bien. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a construir una ramada (espacio cubierto de un techo de ramas) para poder vender sus golosinas tranquilamente protegiéndose de la lluvia.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 29-year-old mother of two two school-age children. She lives with her common-law husband, who always supports her goals. She makes a living selling snacks (cookies, caramels, gum, etc.) outside of her home. She has been doing this for a year, and what she enjoys about her work is meeting many people and giving them good service. The business is profitable because it's in a good location that's often busy and gets a lot of traffic, so things have been going well. This is her second loan, and she has showed herself to be responsible with her payments. With the money she is requesting she will build a shelter to cover her so she can be at ease selling her snacks and protect herself from the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a shelter to cover and protect her business

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en: Yemisi sells frozen foods like turkey, chicken, fish etc. She sells in wholesale and retail to her customers. She needs the loan amount of 50,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers during and after this festive season. Yemisi is 50 years old and married with five children. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Saroeung

texts.en: Mrs. Saroeung M. is a villager in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Saroeung M. is 35 years old and the mother of five: one works in a garment factory, two are attending the local school, and the remaining two are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Yem Yon, is a palm juice collector who gathers the juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Because her farm does not have a high yield, she is requesting a loan to help with feeding her family during this time of low rice supply. Her husband is pictured with her.

loans.use: To purchase food for her family

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites T. and her family are living in Barangay Lulutan, Ilagan, Isabela.  She and her husband are blessed with a son named Marvin who is now six months old.  She is in the direct selling business while her husband is working as a ferry boat operator in their village and sometimes a farmer for additional income.  

Most of her products are Tupperware and other plastic ware.  To further support her business, she is now asking for a loan of PHP4,000.  This amount will not only be used for her direct selling business but also to repair their boat that they are using for transporting their passengers.  She came up with this kind of business because there are times when she and her husband argue because they lack financially.  Now that she had her own business, somehow their income meets the needs of their family.  

“There is no harm in trying” said Marites.  She hopes that someday she will able to contribute towards the progress of their family through her hard works and patience in overcoming difficulties of life.

loans.use: Additional capital and for boat repair

loans.name: Penn

texts.en: S. is 49 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She has five children, all of whom are single. Three of them work in the labor industry and the other two are students. S. is married to Sok, 45, who earns a living catching fish along the Mekong riverside. S. has been a fish seller in the Psar Tom market since 2000. She gets up every morning early to gather fish from her husband and then hurries to sell them in the market. Sometimes she takes her children to help with her husband's fishing. S. wants to increase the number of fish her husband catches, so she is taking a loan of $300 to buy more fishnets. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living. She dreams of her children having a degree and of a big house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for her husband's fishing

loans.name: Chan Nary

texts.en:
Chan Nary U. lives in Pram Bey Mum village, in Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  Aside from this plantation, she is a grocer who owns a small store.  Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. 

Thus, Chan Nary decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to expand her business.  She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.  She is a 42 years old widow with three children, two of whom repair cars while the other attends the local school.

loans.use: Buy more grocery products to expand her business.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est une veuve qui a à sa charge ses trois enfants, elle est une institutrice mais son revenu ne lui permettant pas de couvrir les charges de sa famille, elle a débuté le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale en 2003. Elle fait face actuellement à une rupture de stock. Voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de riz, 07 bidons d’huile, 10 cartons de boîtes de tomates, des liqueurs et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This lady is a widow raising her three children. She is a primary school teacher but her salary did not permit her to cover her family's expenses, so she began selling groceries in 2003. She presently has many items that are out of stock. Wishing to replenish her inventory, she has asked WAGES for her first loan to buy 10 sacks of rice, 7 jerrycans of oil, 10 cases of tinned tomatoes, liqueurs, and various grocery items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Abla Holali

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006. Le commerce de pagnes est en général très développé et très rentable à lomé. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes appelées NANA BENZ à Lomé. Voulant augmenter son stock de marchandises elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes de qualité « hi-target et hollandais ».
texts.en:
This lady sells "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) to earn a living; she has been in this business since 2006. Selling "pagnes" is very well developed and very lucrative in Lomé. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers called NANA BENZ in Lomé. Wishing to add to her inventory, she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 30 lengths of "pagne" of "hi-target" and "hollandais" brands.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of  "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotognogontala est constitué de sept femmes mariées toutes monogames qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles habitent à Bougoula hameau, une des communes rurales  de  Sikasso  (3ème région administrative du Mali).  
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de poissons,  de tasses, de  tissus,  des condiments alimentaires et  des céréales. 
Elles sont à leur  cinquième   collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de  satisfaire le besoin de la  clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre. Tous les prêts précédents ont été  bien remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter  20 colis de condiments, 30 sacs  de 100 kg de céréales, 10 pièces  de pagnes wax et  20 paniers de poissons. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso, dans les villages environnants, à  Mopti  (cinquième région administrative du Mali) et au Burkina Faso (un  pays frontalier du Mali). Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents marchés de Sikasso ville, à domicile et de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, en détail et surtout au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’habillement et  la santé des enfants et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
texts.en:
The Kotognogontala group is made up of seven married women all monogamous who are on average 37 years old and average three children each. They live in the hamlet of Bougoula, one of the rural villages in Sikasso (third administrative region in Mali).

They conduct various activities, among others the sale of fish, cups, fabric, condiments, and cereals.

This is their fifth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the customers demand that keeps on rising. All the previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

With this loan they would like to buy 20 boxes of condiments, 30 100kg bags of cereals, 10 pieces of pagnes Wax [traditional wrap around fabric] and 20 baskets of fish. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of the town of Sikasso, in the surrounding villages , in Mopti (fifth administrative region of Mali) and in Burkina Fasso (a country neighboring Mali). The goods are sold on the various markets in the town of Sikasso, from home, and door to door to customers made up of women and men. They sell retail and above all for cash.

They are planning to each make an average monthly profit of 23,000 CFA [about $50]. One part will be used for the clothing and health care of the children and the other will be invested in the business and the repayment of the loan.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various goods

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 39 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y a sus 3 hijos de 20, 17 y 9 años. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, su metodología consiste en ir de casa en casa de sus clientes con la mercadería que tiene, de acuerdo al pedido reparte y posteriormente cobra por partes, controlando sus cuentas minuciosamente en un cuaderno de apuntes donde tiene su lista de clientes y pedido. Maritza se abastece cada mes de nueva mercadería y siempre está a la búsqueda de nuevos clientes para incrementar sus ventas, pues para ella su trabajo es una gran satisfacción, aunque no le gusten las largas horas de caminata, pero este esfuerzo es compensado con las buenas ganancias que recibe. Para un futuro cercano quiere tener una tienda de ropa en una zona comercial del centro de su ciudad. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de trabajar en un banco comunal y siempre recomienda a otras personas que trabajen de esta manera, pues para ella es una forma efectiva de progresar; por ello, renueva su compromiso de responsabilidad con su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de más prendas de vestir para distribuir los numerosos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Maritza is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their 3 children, who are 20, 17 and 9 years old. She has been selling clothes for the last 15 years. She takes clothes' orders from her customers and once she gets the order, goes to their homes and delivers the merchandise. She sells by a schedule of payments and keeps track of her client’s orders in a notebook.

Maritza restocks new merchandise every month and is always in search of new customers to increase her sales . The work is a great satisfaction to her, but she doesn’t like the long hours walking. Although this effort is compensated by the good profits she receives. She hopes to have a clothing store in a shopping center in downtown in the near future.

This is her third loan with MFP. She is excited to work in a community bank, and always recommend it to others, because it is an effective way to move forward; therefore she renews her commitment to the group. The money requested will be invested in buying more clothing to comply with orders that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Cufamune Gracieta

texts.pt:
Cufamune Gracieta F. nasceu em Bilene Macia (um dos distritos da província de Gaza que se localiza a 230 km a norte de Maputo) é uma mulher bastante trabalhadora, tem 62 anos de idade, viúva e avo de três netos com idades de 12 e 15 anos, todos estudando e sob sua responsabilidade.

 Cufamune estudou ate 4 classe e tendo parado por questões políticas na altura do colonialismo Português no pais.

Saiu da Macia no ano de 1966, sozinha, para boane aonde mais tarde veio a casar com o já falecido marido e vive na casa própria.

É comerciante há bastante tempo e vende, pessoalmente, roupas de segunda mão. Aprendeu a fazer negócios há 23 anos e o produto com mais saída é o fato completo para homens e que o custo por unidade é de 1.800,00MT. Adquire a mercadoria na cidade de Maputo a custos razoáveis. Com os rendimentos consegue custei ar as despesa familiares, incluindo a sua irmã que vive longe dela.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos e este é o seu segundo credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema, no valor de 25.000,00MT que pretende reforçar o volume do negocio e satisfazer a demanda de produtos neste momento de inverno.
O primeiro credito foi de 15.000,00MT para exercer a mesma actividade. Teve informações sobre as operações da hluvuku através de amigas e residentes no distrito de boane.
Propõe se a pagar em harmonia com o plano de prestações e pedir novos empréstimos para vender os produtos a grosso.
texts.en:
Cufamune Gracieta F. was born in Bilene Macia (one of districts in Gaza province located 230 km north of Maputo). She is a hardworking woman, 62 years old, a widow with three grandchilren between the ages of 12 and 15. All of them are in school, and she is their guardian. Cufamune went to school until 4th grade, when she had to stop because of political turmoil during Portuguese colonial rule of the country. She left Macia in 1966, going by herself to Boane, where she later married her late husband. She lives in her own house. She's been a shopkeeper for some time and sells secondhand clothing. She learned business 23 years ago and the most popular products are men's suits, which she sells for 1800 meticals each. She acquires her goods in the city of Maputo at affordable prices. She uses her earnings to cover family expenses, including supporting her sister, who lives far away. She's never received loans from other banks, and this is her second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 25,000 meticals. She intends to use the loan to increase her sales and satisfy the demand for products during this winter season. She used her first loan of 15,000 meticals for the same purpose. She learned about Hluvuku through friends and residents of Boane. She intends to pay off her loan in full and on time, and to request new loans so she can begin selling products wholesale.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe A. tiene ya más de ocho con su negocio de papelería. Ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
Ella quiere invertir en compara mas mercancía para el regreso a clases es cuando tiene las mejores ventas, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Es por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo y planea pagarlo con las ganancias del negocio.
Cuando se realizo la visita del negocio de la señora Guadalupe ella no se encontraba andaba comprando mercancía para el negocio quien nos atendió fue su esposo el señor Santiago Olguín quien es la persona de la foto.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guadalupe A. has been with her stationary business for more than eight years now. She has already gotten two loans with FVP which she has repaid punctually. She wants to invest in buying merchandise for the back-to-school season since it is when she has the best sales, but she currently does not have the necessary capital for the investment and she does not want her business to lose money since it is her family's source of income. It is for this reason that she is requesting the loan and plans to pay it back with the profits from her business. When the site visit was done Guadalupe was not there because she was out buying merchandise for the business. The person who helped us was her husband, Mr. Santiago Olguín, who is shown in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the "back-to-school" season

loans.name: Karema Group

texts.en: Karema is the group leader of Karema group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants a loan for expanding their business. So they are requesting a group of loan of 42,000 Afghani. Karema wants to take a loan for her husband who has car parts shop. Sediqa wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving. Hanefa wants to take a loan for her husband who has cookie shop.  They are very happy for this process of getting a loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding the business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a member of the Embacassy 1 In Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 42 years old woman,she is married and e mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 3,8,12,15,18 and 22 years.

Fatuma started her own crops business selling Tobacco,beans 20 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Embacassy first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 In order to buy more crops for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Fatuma hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beans,and  tobacco

loans.name: Juana Jeannette

texts.es: Juana Jeannette U. Cortez tiene 35 años de edad. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con fundación león 2000 y es una mujer my responsable, además siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Ella se levanta muy temprano todos los días, ya que tiene que atender a sus 4 hijos por lo que siempre tiene que estar pendientes de ellos, por lo que siempre ha invertido el financiamiento en capital de trabajo y en base a mucho trabajo ha logrado obtener este negocio. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, aceite, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, jabón y detergentes. Humildemente solamente sueña con seguir aumentando con productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Jeannette U. Cortez is 35 years old. She runs a local store. She has worked with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and is a very responsible woman who has always enjoyed working. She gets up very early every day so that she can look after her 4 children, for whom she must care at all times. It is for them that she has always invested in so much hard work and through her hard work, she has obtained this business. She is asking for this loan so that she will have enough capital to buy inventory such as candy, oil, beans, rice, sugar, soap and detergent. She humbly dreams only of continuing to expand her business with more store products.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase store inventory: candy, oil, beans, rice, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo Martín de 41, él es estibador, tiene 3 hijos: Jonatan de 16, Marcia de 15 y Samir de 4 años de edad, todos viven muy contentos en su casa propia. Desde hace 8 años ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que le gusta mucho, ya que le brinda independencia y libertad en su economía, pues así no sólo depende del sueldo de su esposo y puede desempeñarlo en los momentos en que dispone de tiempo sin descuidar su hogar. Además los ingresos que logra son muy rentables y María tiene la esperanza de hacerlo crecer mucho más. Para el futuro quiere tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer de manera más cómoda su mercadería, ya que actualmente debe visitar casa por casa a sus clientas, resultándole muy cansado el recorrido, pero felizmente tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y sabe que cumplirá sus sueños. Es el sétimo préstamo de María con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos, además el trabajo con su grupo es muy bueno, ya que todas son buenas amigas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para tenerla en stock y venderla de forma inmediata, sin esperar los pedidos por catálogo.
texts.en:
María, 37, lives with her husband, Martín, 41, a docker, and has three children: Jonatan, 16, Marcia, 15, and Samir, 4. They live together happily in their own house. For the past 8 years, María has been working in the sale of beauty products, an activity that she likes a lot and that offers her independence and freedom with her finances. In which case, she doesn't have to depend solely on her husband's salary and can carry out her activities when she has available time without neglecting her home life. Besides, the income she makes is very profitable and María hopes to grow the business much more. In the future, she would like to have a shop where she could offer her merchandise more conveniently, as she currently has to visit her clients' houses, house by house, and the travel makes her very tired. But she is keen to succeed and knows that she will achieve her dreams. This is María's seventh loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual with repayments, beside she enjoys working with the group as they are all good friends. With the money requested, María will buy a greater quantity of merchandise to keep in stock and sell immediately, without having to wait for orders from catalogues.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Amamadine Khoja Parsa Group

texts.en: Bibi Jan is the group leader of Amamadine Khoja Parsa group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive a loan for their business. The requested a group loan of 20000 Afghani.Bibi Jan wants to take a loan for her business of leather sewing. Also M. Hamaun wants to take a loan for his business of general store. And Amamadine wants to take a loan for his business of taxi driver. They are very happy with this small loan in Afghanistan thanks all lender of AFSG and Kiva processes in this poor city

loans.use: they make larger their business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia A. is from the village of Tawi-tawi. She is 46 years old. Leticia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Leticia operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Leticia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Leticia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mercedes es una mujer trabajadora que por mucho años logro tener su propio negocio junto su esposo, tenían un pequeño comedor en donde vendía una variedad de comida. A la raíz que su esposo murió todo se vino abajo ya que nada fue igual y poco a poco cerró el comedor, procreo cuatro hijos los cuales trabajan y son ello quien ayudan a pagar los gastos básicos, alimentación y las mejoras de la casa, ellos se dedican a cultivar las tierras en el campo en el departamento de Matagalpa donde se cultiva el café, el arroz  y frijoles entre otros granos básicos. Ella se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, durante nueve ciclo ha trabajado con Afodenic y ha hecho las mejoras en su negocio. Con este préstamo desea cambiar las puertas de enfrente para mejor seguridad ya que la madera esta podrida y se ve con la necesidad de cambiarla. Con ayuda de sus hijos lograra salir adelante, en las necesidades.  Sus objetivos es volver a poner su negocio con los financiamientos espera lograrlo solo se esta dando un tiempo para comenzar.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a hardworking woman who was able to maintain her own business for many years, working together with her husband. They operated a small restaurant in which they sold a variety of foods. When her husband died, however, things went downhill; nothing was the same, and the restaurant eventually closed. Mercedes has four children who are working, and they help her to pay her basic costs such as food and home repair. They work cultivating land in the rural areas of the Department of Matagalpa, where coffee, rice and beans are grown, among other basic staples. Mercedes is now dedicating herself to the needs of her home; she has worked with Afodenic during nine loan cycles to improve her business. With this loan, she wants to change the doors at the front of her house to improve security, since the wood has rotted and they need to be replaced. With her children's help, she will continue to make progress and cover her needs. Her goal is to reopen her business, and with the financing she hopes to achieve this; she is just giving herself a little time to get started.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing her two front doors because the wood has rotted

loans.name: Jacob Omeno

texts.en:
Jacob Omeno is 37 years old and married to Everlyne, who is 31 and a salon operator by profession. They have a daughter, 9, and two sons, age 6 and 3 respectively. Jacob makes sandals, brake pads and bicycle rubber fittings from used tires. The sandals are popular in the neighborhood due to their durability. He has been in this business for the last 19 years. 

This is Jacob's second loan from KADET, a Kiva partner, and he intends to use it to purchase more stock of used tires.

Jacob aspires to purchase land and develop a commercial building where he can operate his shoe-making business.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more used tires for his art-and-craft business and diversify to farming

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola M. is currently in the business of baking local Sudanese bread and cakes and is requesting a loan to stock more baking ingredients like flour, sugar, baking powder etc.  Viola is 30 years old and is married to a teacher. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more baking ingredients

loans.name: Turbat

texts.en: Turbat P., 35, lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan, one of Mongolia's western provinces.  His two children are 11 and 13 years old and both attend local secondary schools.  His wife is a construction worker and usually travels to various construction sites outside the town.  Turbat usually takes care of his two children and is responsible for family duties. He sells various food products like fruit, dairy products and more from a stall he rents at the local food market.   He sells fruit during warm season and dairy products when it is cold. With his business profits, he started to build a small house for his family.  He says that he would like to see his two children obtain a good education and pursue their dreams without any financial setbacks.  He requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for his business.

loans.use: Purchase dairy products.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina A. is from the village of Bandera. She is 59 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Agustina owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years with approximate average monthly earnings of 3,000 PHP. In 2006, Agustina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to cover the cost of farm cultivation and to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Agustina is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her daily expenses and to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for farm cultivation and to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa J. D. M. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en la Ciudad D. Soyapango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos y una nuera. María es una señora quien a su edad, trabaja arduamente en su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad. A pesar que cuenta con varios años D. tener su negocio, ella no ha podido surtirla con todos los productos necesarios, los cuales las personas comprar con mayor frecuencia. Es por esta razón que la señora María solicita un préstamo, el cual le permita contar con el dinero necesario para comprar productos como detergentes, carnes, embutidos y otros más. Para la señora María es muy importante el poder surtir la tienda, ya que es D. esta forma por la cual obtiene la mayor cantidad D. dinero para brindarle esa ayuda tan necesaria a su esposo para los gastos D. ambos, esto debido a que sus hijos son mayores D. edad y ellos cuentan con su propio trabajo. A pesar D. esto María trabaja mucho para contar con una mejor estabilidad económica junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
María Teresa J. D. M., 60, lives with her husband, two children, and a daughter-in-law in the city of Soyapango. María is a woman, who at her age, works arduously in her own business. She has a store selling perishable basic needs items. Even though she has had the business for several years, she has not been able to stock it with all of the necessary products, which people buy more frequently. That is the reason that María is asking for a loan. It will allow her to buy products like detergents, meat, sausages, and other things. Being able to stock the store is very important to María because that is the way she gets more money. She gives her husband the much needed help to pay their expenses. This is because their children are adults, and they have their own jobs. In spite of this, María works a lot to have better economic stability together with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products

loans.name: Sabagul

texts.ru: Манонова Сабагул проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж, преподает в школе. Сама Сабагул не имеет высшего образования. У нее собственный магазин, где она торгует более 4 лет. Ей помогает сын. Она привозит товары из города Душанбе. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Сабагул намерена увеличить ассортимент свего товара, чтобы привлечь внимание клиентов.
texts.en:
Sabagul M. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 41 years old; married with 2 children. Her husband is a teacher at school. Sabagul herself does not have a higher education. She has her own store, where she has been trading for over 4 years. Her son helps her. She brings goods from Dushanbe. She is requesting the loan to increase her volume of trade. Sabagul plans to increase the selection of her products in order to attract customers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase volume of trade

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à N’Tjifina sous préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des condiments alimentaires et de l’arachide.
Ces femmes du groupe Djekafo viennent de commencer leur collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance avec qui, elles sont à leur  premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des paquets de condiments alimentaires et des sacs d’arachide.
Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments le plus généralement à Fana et l’arachide est acheté dans les environs du village. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Nangola, Fana et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women from the Djekafo group are all married with an average age of 42 and on average four children. They all live in traditional extended families in N’Tjifina sub-prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship and sell condiments and peanuts. These women from the Djekafo group just began their collaboration with the microfinance institution. This is their first group loan that will be used to buy packs of condiments and bags of peanuts. They source their condiments from Fana and the peanuts are bought in the vicinity of the village. They sell their goods at the Nangola and Fana markets and at the large fairs in the area. They sell for cash or on credit to customers who are women and men. They each are planning to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 Francs CFA which will be used for the daily family expenses and reinvested in the business’ s activities.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments and peanuts.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a business man. He has a motorcycle that he uses to convey his passengers from one location of his city to another. He loves this because he renders services to his customers. He is doing well in his business and family. He is married with four children. As a hard working man, he works for long hours to enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. He hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase a motorcycle to boost his business. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to boost his business.

loans.name: Missael

texts.en:
Missael B. is from the village of Kahulugan, Gingoog City. She is 33 years-old and married with three school-aged children.  Missael owns and operates a business  in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting coconut and mango fruits for sale. Missael has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Missael joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Missael has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Missael is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Missael from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa de Guadalupe está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Martha Rosa Colegial L. quien con unos ahorros invirtió en  ropa y luego con las ganancias del negocio y los prestamos empezó a comercializar también zapatos.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Lisett del Carmen R. de 36 años quien vende desde refrescos, bolis, helados y hace poca ropa y Cecilia Dora T. vende cortes de tela de manera ambulante en los andes del mercado y las calles de Managua.
texts.en:
The Rosa de Guadalupe Group is comprised of three hardworking women. One of them is Ms. Martha Rosa Colegial L., who invested her savings in a clothing business, then used her profits to start selling footwear as well.

Her fellow group members are Lisett del Carmen R., age 36, who sells drinks, ice cream, frozen popsicles, and makes some clothing; and Cecilia Dora T., who sells fabric as a street vendor in the open-air markets and the streets of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and footwear

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan R. is currently in the business of selling dried fish and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. Juan is 40 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has 5 children, and 3 of them go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is now divorced with six children and all her children go to school. Margaret takes care of additional family members like her old parents and her sister's children. Formerly Margaret was selling second hand clothes but she changed her business enterprise to making envelopes and paper bags. She buys her raw materials from Nkrumah Road shops in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from buying these raw materials. She has been doing this business for the last three months. Margaret is now proud of this business.  Besides this business, she doesn’t have any other side business.  She wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like papers and glue.  She aspires to have a shop where she can display and sell her products. She joined MCDT because it was charging low interest.  Margret owns and resides in a four-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more  raw materials like papers and glue

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Mr. Sot P. is 26 years old and resides in a rural area of Siem Reap Province. He has a small business in which the main activity is to buy and sell cows, called 'ox-trader'. Sot P. is married with a young child who attends primary school. His wife stays at home to do housework or cultivate rice. 

Mr. Sot P. always leaves home to buy animals and brings them to fatten for a while before selling them to other people. By doing this, he is able to make US$ 5 a day to cover the financial needs of his family. Because the cow trade is very profitable for his family, Sot P. is looking for additional capital to sustain his business growth.

loans.use: To sustain the business growth

loans.name: Guiselle

texts.es:
Guiselle  C. V. es una señora de 43 años de edad, quien vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico, ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; la que es conocida como una comunidad muy tranquila y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Desde hace 2 años ella se dedica a la siembra de papaya y de papa China , por lo tanto dice que posee bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivos, tiene un  terreno en el cual ha sembrado papaya anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirla por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Guiselle  es un micro crédito de ¢629,000 (seiscientos veintinueve mil colones), para comprar fertilizantes, semillas y sembrar un hectárea de papaya, además de los  insumos  necesarios para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Guiselle forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico; una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socia ha recibido 2 microcrédito que le ha permitido tener un ingreso que le permita tener una mejor calidad de Vida.
texts.en:
Guiselle C. V. is a 43 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children in the rural Costa Rican community of Abanico, which is located in San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Alajuela Province. This community is known for being a peaceful area where the main industries are agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism.

For the past two years, Guiselle has been growing papayas and Chinese potatoes. She says she has enough experience in caring for and maintaining these types of crops. Guiselle has a plot land where she grows papaya. Given the good results she has achieved in the past, she now wants to expand her farm. Thanks to this business, the quality of life for her family has improved considerably.

At the moment, Guiselle is requesting a microloan of 629,000 CRC in order to buy fertilizers and seeds required to grow a hectare full of papaya. These supplies are needed to provide the best maintenance and care possible until it is time to harvest. In the end, she hopes to be rewarded for having very good production.

Guisella is part of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Abanico, one of 100 member organizations that form EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member, she has received two microloans that have allowed her to generate income so that she can have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & seeds for growing papaya

loans.name: Velinda Silvia

texts.es: L. Sra. Velinda inicio su negocio con L. venta D. frutas y quesos en un puesto en un mercado eso fue posible gracias a su cuñada  que luego le traspaso el negocio. Velinda tiene 2 hijas que son su razón D. vivir, elL. cuenta con L. ayuda D.  su esposo para mantener los gastos en casa ya que su esposo trabaja como chofer. ElL. se siente contenta trabajando con Edaprosopo y Kiva. su único objetivo es que sus hijas sean profesionales además del bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Velinda started her business selling fruits and cheese in a market stall owned by her sister-in-law, who later passed on the business to her. Velinda has 2 daughters, who she considers her reason for living. Velinda's husband helps proviD. for the family by working as a driver. Velinda is happy working with Edaprosopo and Kiva. Her dream is for her daughters to have professional careers and to proviD. for the wellbeing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products.

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es:
El Señor Bacilio nacido el 28 de Febrero de 1966 en Cochabamba casado con la Sra. Filiberta con 7 hijos. Hace 6 años que el compro una parcela en 2 hectareas en la localidad de San Carlos a 25 Km de Limoncito. En la cual el vive y trabaja desde entonces con su esposa y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la siembra, cosecha y la comercializacion en el mercado de el Torno.                                             
Es primera ves que Esta sacando Credito de Emprender, el dinero lo utilizara  para la siembra de Yuca. También él pertenece o es socio de un centro de acopio de Maiz.
texts.en:
Sr. Bacilio was born on February 28, 1966, in Cochabamba. He is married to Sra. Filiberta and they have seven children. Six years ago he bought a parcel of land that measures two hectares in the town of San Carlos, which is 25km away from Limoncito. There he lives and works with his wife and children. The crops that they plant and harvest are sold at the market in El Torno.

This is the first loan he is requesting from Emprender. The money will be used for planting cassava. Bacilio is also a member of the local corn collection center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inputs for growing cassava

loans.name: Kochkorbai

texts.en:
Kochkorbai N. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town on the south of Kyrgyzstan.  Kochkorbai is 49 and married. He has four sons and a daughter. The two older sons are engaged in farming, the third son is a musician, the daughter is at school and the fourth son is a newborn. Kochkorbai has been growing rice since 1995. By selling some of the harvest, he makes 5,500 soms per month. That profit made it possible for him to purchase cattle, repair the house and purchase a vehicle. With the money received from the loan, Kochkorbai wants to purchase one ton of mineral fertilizers for growing rice. In the near future, he plans to celebrate his older son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
1102-016507-01

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
Rosa Aurora R. tiene 52 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 7 hijos de 27 hasta 10 anos. 

Rosa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Rosa se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz, trigo, y cevada. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda cada semana.
 
Solicita el credito para comprar un ganado. Con el apoyo del credito le permitira aumentar sus bacas. Su sueno es tener 6 bacas dentro de los proximos 5 anos. Se desafia con la falta de alimiento para sus bacas.
texts.en:
Rosa Aurora R. is 52 years old. She is married and lives in the canton of Guaranda in the providence Bolívar in Ecuador. She has seven children, ranging in age from 10 to 27 years old. Rosa is a member of the rural solidarity group Gradas Chico, which is located fifteen minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. The group has 20 members in total, the majority of whom grow corn, wheat, and potatoes and raise animals. This is the third loan this group has taken with the cooperative. Rosa is involved with agriculture, cultivating corn, wheat, and barley. She does her shopping and sells her products in the Guaranda market every week. Rosa is asking for the loan to buy livestock. With the support of the credit, she will be able to increase the number of cows she owns. Her dream is to have six cows within the next five years. She currently struggles to provide enough food for her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn A. is a married woman who lives in Purok Pine Tree, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: food vending, fishing and a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Julito Mojillo, who is 41 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have seven children who range in age from 7 months to 22 years old. Four of the children already work to help her support their family and one is still going to school. Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family.
