This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: as additional business capital

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia González esta agradecida por que se le otorgo un crédito en esta institución el cual pudo realizar una parte de su proyecto. Ahora esta protegida ya que la barda que construyo la hizo alta, pero en este momento requiere el préstamo para enjarrarla para que se vea bien.
Cecilia es una joven soltera que piensa en el futuro, seguridad de su casa tanto como de ella. La joven trabaja en un banco como cajera y con estos ingresos pagara el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Cecilia González is grateful for the loan she was given in this institution. She was able to complete part of her project with the loan. Now she is protected because the wall she built is tall. But, now she needs a loan to stucco it so that it looks good. Cecilia is a young single woman who thinks of the future security of her house as well as her own safety. She works in a bank as a cashier. She will use this income to pay for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stucco the wall

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina A. is from the village of Cabu-an, Guinsiliban, Camiguin. She is 19 years old, is married, and has infant children. Nina owns and operates a business selling "ukay-ukay" or used clothing to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Nyambuu

texts.en:
Nyambuu E. lives with his wife and 1-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and the capital of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home looking after their son.

E. operates an electronic appliance and cellphone repair service in the city. He has much skill in his trade and can repair a variety of electronic goods and cellphones. He operates mainly out of his rented office but also makes visits to his customers’ homes to make repairs.

E. started his business in 2005 after graduating from an electronics repair course. He has found much success and always looks to expand his business. His earnings have enabled him to hire two assistants and to register his business as a company, "Arshi Tenger" Co. Ltd. For the future, E. says, "I hope to one day own my own workspace."

E. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase tools and electronic parts for his repair business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and electronic parts for his repair business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy dreams to have a successful and productive business. She has been selling vegetables at Cauayan Public Market for almost ten years now and her weekly net income is PHP500.00. She wanted to request a loan amount of PHP10,000.00, to purchase additional merchandise for her business.  

She is married to a farmer named Mauro G.. The couple is blessed with eight children, the eldest is only 17 years old, and the youngest is three months old. They are harmoniously residing at the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is in front of the village hall. She wants to live a simple life even though the family sometimes has make ends meet due to inadequate budget. According to her, money is not so much important in our life, all they need is peace in their hearts.

loans.use: Additional Capital in her vegetable vending business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 32 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Rosarito, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios, como: jugos, juanes, tamalitos, arroz chaufa, arroz con pollo; dulces y golosinas; chifles, canchitas, refrescos y jugos, ubicada en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente tiene muy buena acogida, nos cuenta que se inicio por ella misma y con un capital de S/. 300.00. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien diariamente.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos en kilos y huevos en javas, aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente muy bien, para seguir con sus ventas de refrigerios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Rosario, 32, is a member of the "Mujeres de la Colina II" communal bank located in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her partner and is the mother of two children, both of whom are students and still dependent financially on her. Rosarito, as she is affectionately called, sells snacks like: juices, juanes (a type of banana-leaf-wrapped tamal), tamalitos, arroz chaufa (a fried rice dish similar to Chinese fried rice), chicken and rice, candies, sweets, chifles (fried plantain), canchitas (popcorn), soft-drinks and juices, from her home. She has a well-equipped area and daily she is well received by her customers. She tells us that she started herself with an investment of 300 new soles. She continues with the same business and she relates that she does well daily. With this 1,800 new sol loan she plans to buy ingredients for her prepared items such as: sacks of rice and sugar, kilograms of chicken, crates of eggs, dozens of oil, and cooking utensils to provide quality service. She feels very good to continue selling her refreshments. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her meeting her goals and having her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for refreshments preparation.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: A. Juliette est née en 1962 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Il y a 20 ans environs que Juliette vit à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AKOUTA Basil un chauffeur, Juliette est mère de quatre enfants. Deux autres enfants sont à sa charge. Tous les enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Juliette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Cadjèhoun. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Juliette n'a fait que le cours primaire. Il y a près de 20 ans que Juliette vend du pain accompagnée de la mayonnaise à son domicile. Juliette mène également comme activité secondaire, la vente de bouillie (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs). C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Juliette s'approvisionne. Juliette est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C'est dans l'optique d'augmenter son fonds de roulement afin d'agrandir son activité que Juliette sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Juliette A. was born in 1962 in Ouidah, historical city of Benin. Juliette has lived for about 20 years in Cadjèhoun, a city area of Cotonou, financial capital of Benin. She is married to Basil AKOUTA, a driver, and mother of four children. She is also taking care of two foster children. All the children are not attending school. Juliette lives with her husband and the six children in Cadjèhoun. The couple is providing together for the family's expenses. Juliette graduated only from primary school. For almost twenty years Juliette has sold bread with mayonnaise from her home. Juliette is also running a second business, selling bouillie, a local food product, prepared with corn meal. Juliette buys her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Juliette is ALIDé's old client and she fully repaid her previous loans. Now she is requesting a third loan, in order to increase her operating funds and to enlarge her business.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bread and mayonnaise

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: B. Flavia is a hardworking business woman of thirty-eight years of age. She is blessed with five children. She owns a pub which she has been operating for over five years, that is, since the year 2004. She is using the loan to purchase pub items such as crates of drinks and more. She also provides accommodation services, and she wants to purchase more bed sheets, blankets and so forth. She is a determined business woman whose aim is to open up a motor spare parts shop for more income.

loans.use: To purchase pub items such as crates of drinks, and accomodation items such bed sheets and blankets.

loans.name: Jamsran

texts.en: Jamsran L. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan province, one of Mongolia's far western provinces. His two children both go to a local secondary school. Jamsran is a talented carpenter. He makes traditional wooden furniture such as chairs, tables, beds, etc. He has been making handcrafted traditional furniture since 2002. He is quite successful with his business at this point. His furniture is quite well known among the locals for its good quality and he has one full-time employee who helps him in his business. Besides the furniture, he also makes handcrafted traditional wood frame tents. Most of the local people live in wooden felt-covered tents in which Mongols have been living for more than thousands of years. For now, he has two purchase orders for fully equipped tents and he requests a loan to purchase the necessary wood and other materials to finish his two tent orders.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary wood

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza E. is 33 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Dilfuza is involved in breeding cattle and raising small cattle. She buys the small cattle from the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. 

Her husband also attends to this business. Dilfuza works hard in order to make the business successful and to generate a stable income for the family. Today Dilfuza is planning to purchase three cattle for her household for raising and future selling. For this purpose she requests $1500 USD.  Dilfuza would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es: El joven José tiene 22 años de edad, es un padre de familia de un hijo, junto con su esposa se esfuerzan para poder tener una mejor vivienda, el trabaja como asesor de venta en la compañía Coca Cola, en donde recorre toda la capital, como los departamentos para ofrecer los productos. Su prioridad es cada día mejorar la casa, con el crédito anterior logro hacer un cuarto, ahora desea repellar las paredes, comprar puertas seguras ya que las que tiene están en malas condiciones, poner el piso ya que es de tierra y lograr mejor higiene como pintar. Para esto comprara materiales de construcción como:, arena, cemento, piedrin, piso y pintura  para comenzar la obra, ya que solo mediante con el  financiamiento puede hacer estas mejoras, ya que su salario es un básico y gana por comisión de venta, es por eso desde horas temprana sale a trabajar para poder ganar un poco mejor y poder sastifacer las necesidades de su familia. Como ofrecer una mejor vivienda. El cual esta logrando con ayuda de Afodenic.
texts.en:
José is a young 22 year-old man who is the father of a family with one child. Together with his wife he works hard to improve their home. José works as a salesman for the Coca Cola company, traveling all over the capital to offer their products. His priority is to each day improve the house; with the previous loan he has succeeded in adding a room. Now he wants to plaster the walls, purchase secure doors, as the current ones are in poor shape, add a floor, as the current one is just dirt, and improve the decoration by painting. For these projects José will purchase construction materials like sand, cement, stone, flooring, and paint to begin. Only with this loan can he make these improvements, as his salary is minimal and he gets paid by commission. For this reason he leaves very early to work in the morning to earn a little more and thus be able to satisfy his family's needs, like a better home. He is succeeding with the help of Afodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sand, cement, stone, flooring, and doors to make improvements to his family's living conditions

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia C. is from the village of  Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Bonifacia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Bonifacia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Bonifacia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to invest in expanding the business. Bonifacia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguitougou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Zagnenabougou, sous préfecture de Fana,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens professionnels et de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires et de céréales.                                                                                      
Les membres du groupe Djiguitougou sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des paquets de  condiments et 5 sacs de céréales.                                                                          
Les produits sont achetés sur place au village et le plus souvent dans les environnants. Elles effectuent leurs ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguitougou group, all married, on average are 37 years old and have 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Zagnenabougou, in Fana sub-prefecture in Koulikoro (the second Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). Through their business and family ties they are well known, and trade in condiments and food grains. They have applied for their fourth loan, to be be used to buy packets of condiments and 5 sacks of grain. The products are purchased locally, in their village but mostly in neighboring communities. They sell door-to-door and also inn nearby marketplaces for cash and credit to both women and men. They hope that they will each make an average profit of 25,000F CFA to spend on health, food, and school fees. Anything left over will be reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy condiments and food grains

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a wife of M. H. and lives in a city named Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Her husband is a painter by profession. He paints buildings and windows on order. He has been in this profession since he was just 15 years old. Shamim has given birth to five children. All of them are getting an education from the local school. 

She is an uneducated lady but she knows the value of education and her husband also wants to raise their children with good education. She is applying for a loan to buy the required items such as (paint brushes and other tools) to expand her husband’s painting business.

She has two other ladies in her loan group. Sugran wants a loan to buy items (scissors, shampoos and shaving blades) for her barber shop. Niamat wants a loan to buy construction supplies (cement & bricks) to resell.

loans.use: To buy require tools

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda B. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old. Erlinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. She also sells biscuits and some spices. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase inventory and as working capital. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Conchan De Milagro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco  Conchan de Milagro está formado por un grupo de señoras que siempre buscan el bienestar para sus familias y lo están logrando con el esfuerzo de su trabajo diario, su perseverancia,  viven en la comunidad Conchan de Milagro ubicada  a unos 45 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y  es un bello sector ya que desde allí se puede observar la ciudad de Cuenca.

La señora Blanca C. es socia de éste banco desde hace tres ciclos,  tiene 22 años y  vive  en unión libre con su pareja y su hijo de dos meses de nacido  en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos del hogar porque aún no tienen casa propia, su esposo trabaja en una carpintería y ella se dedica  a la costura, estudió tres años en una academia, trabajaba en una fábrica de jeans pero con el nacimiento de su primogénito  dejó de trabajar.

Blanca tiene una linda amistad con todas sus compañeras del bankito, los préstamos recibidos ha invertido en el nacimiento de  su bebé,  con el nuevo crédito va a pagar una cómoda que adquirió  para su bebe, su meta es  seguir en lo que más le gusta que es la costura.

Rosa Domínguez se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en su banco comunal invitada por sus amigas y socias del bankito, los créditos le han beneficiado para comprar pollos y cuyes actividad que inició hace dos años  compartiendo con los quehaceres del hogar y cuidado de sus hijos,  éstos animales cría tanto para venderlos como para el consumo en su hogar.

Nuestra  vive en la comunidad Conchan de Milagro a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, está casada hace algunos años  y es madre de seis hijos que se  encuentran  de 17, 15, 13, 10, 9, 8 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos se estudian  en diferentes colegios de la ciudad y los tres  menores en una escuela de la localidad,  su esposo trabaja en una carpintería pero siempre se encuentra haciendo trabajos extras fuera de su trabajo para redondear su sueldo, además nos comenta que la casa en la que viven es propia fruto de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio conyugal

Con el dinero del credito solicitado comprará  una sierra eléctrica  para los trabajos de carpintería de su esposo.  Tiene como máximo  sueño ver a sus hijos llegar a ser unos grandes profesionales en la especialidad que ellos elijan.
texts.en:
The Conchan de Milagro bank is made up of a group of women who are always looking out for the good of their families, and they are succeeding by the effort they put into their daily work and perseverance. They live in the Conchan de Milagro community located about 45 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. The people work in farming and it’s a beautiful area because from there, they can see the city of Cuenca. Mrs. Blanca C. has been a member of this bank for three cycles. She is 22, and lives in a common-law marriage with her partner and two-month-old son. He was born in the home that they share with her mother and they pay some of the household expenses since they still don’t have their own house. Her husband works as a carpenter and she in sewing. She studied for three years at a school, and was working in a jeans factory but left when her first child was born. Blanca has a lovely friendship with all her companions at the bank. The loans that she has received she has used for the birth of her son. With the new loan she’s going to pay for a dresser for the baby. Her goal is to continue in what she likes most, sewing. Rosa D. is in her second loan cycle in the community bank. She was invited by her friends and members of the bank. She has used the loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs in the last two year, dividing up her time with the household chores and caring for her children. She raises the animals to sell as well as for consumption in her own house. Our member lives in the Conchan de Milagro community in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. She has been married for some years and is the mother of six children, 17, 15, 13, 10, 9 and 8. Her three oldest are studying in different schools in the city and the three youngest in a local school. Her husband is a carpenter but he is always looking for extra work to round out his salary. She also comments that the house where they live is the fruit of their effort and the sacrifices by the two of them. She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy an electric saw for her husband’s carpentry work. Her biggest dream is to see her children become successful professionals in the fields that they choose.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dresser and an electric saw

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last 20 years. She sells all of her farm output to middlemen who later sell it to the National Cereals Board. She is 46 years old and married to Tonkoi Pareiyo. They have five children.

Lucy was introduced to KADET by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the money to harvest her maize and to plant potatoes and cabbage on her land.

Lucy plans to start selling her maize to the National Cereals Board directly, as it is more profitable.

loans.use: To harvest maize on her farm and to plant potatoes and cabbage

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old. She is married with three children, ages, 18, 15 and 12 years old. All her children are currently attending school. 

She is a farmer from western Kenya in Kitale town. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years. Her main products are tomatoes, bananas, maize and milk, which she sells to the local market. She depends solely on her farming activities to provide for her family. Her main challenges are poor means of transport, high production costs and the lack of enough capital for expansion.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income coming from this loan will improve her family's standard of living and also pay school fees for her children. She hopes to expand her dairy farming and get five good grade cows in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fayziali

texts.ru: Нормамадов Файзиали проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 34 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена занимается растениеводством. Сам Файзиали имеет средне - специальное образование. Работает по профессии. Предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области более 5 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, т.е. он хочет установить оборудование для природного газа и поменять шины.
texts.en:
Fayziali N. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 34 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is involved in agriculture. Fayziali has a secondary-specialized education and works in his field. He provides a taxi service. Fayziali has been in this field for over 5 years. He is requesting this loan for car repair, specifically, he wants to install a natural gas conversion kit and change tires.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora M. M. tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, calzado, perfumes y otros, con esto les provee de alimentación y otros gastos a su familia además que la señora se apoya con el esposo ya que él tiene un taxi y le ayuda, esta solicitándole a CEPRODEL un financiamiento para la compra de blusas, pantalones de mujer, cosméticos y perfumes, sandalias y zapatos para varón deportivos ya que ella también vende por encargos, el sueño de ella es terminar de construir su casita para darle una vida digna a sus hijos quienes actualmente se encuentran estudiando.
texts.en:
Señora M. M. has a business selling clothing, footwear, perfumes and other items. Through this business, she is able to provide food for her family and to help with household expenses. In addition, Sra. M. Monga receives support from her husband, since he has a taxi and is able to help her out. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to purchase blouses, women's pants, cosmetics and perfumes, sandals and men's athletic shoes. She also sells by pre-orders. Her dream is to finish construction on her little house in order to give her children, who are currently students, a good life.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of blouses, women's pants, cosmetics and perfumes, sandals and men's athletic shoes.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 33 años, es un ejemplar padre de familia, que lucha ante las adversidades, él está separado de su pareja alrededor de un año, y se hace cargo de su pequeño hijo Ángel de 3 años, con quien vive en una casa alquilada. La agricultura, es la actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 13 años, al cultivar plátanos, piña y café, en sus terrenos propios y arrendados. Es entonces que Edwin todos los días, prepara sus alimentos para luego dirigirse a sus chacras, en compañía de su pequeño hijo, pues no tiene con quien dejarlo, y permanecen juntos casi todo el día cuidando sus tierras. De toda la labor que realiza, le gusta cosechar los granos de café, asimismo le gusta escogerlos para luego venderlos a los comerciantes mayoristas, quienes conocen la calidad de su fruto y le pagan considerable ganancias. Tener mayor cantidad de plantas de café, le genera productividad, por lo que es bastante rentable cultivar este producto, que vende a S/. 8.00 soles el kilo, por ello planea construir una casa propia y continuar adquiriendo terrenos donde pueda continuar incrementando sus plantaciones. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y como persona entusiasta que es, se siente contento de continuar trabajando en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono y contratar operarios.
texts.en:
Edwin, 33 years old, is a model father who fights through adversity. He has been separated from his partner for about a year, and he is raising their small three-year old son, Angel. They live together in a rented house. Edwin has worked in agriculture for 13 years, and he grows plantains, pineapples, and coffee on his own land as well as land that he rents. So every day Edwin prepares his meals and heads off to his fields, and he brings his young son with him because he has no one to leave the child with. They spend all day together caring for their land. Of all the work that he does, Edwin enjoys planting coffee and picking the beans to sell them to the commercial wholesalers, who recognize the quality of his product and pay him a good price. He hopes to plant more coffee plants because this is a very profitable product, which sells for 8 soles per kilo. He hopes to build his own house and continue to acquire land in order to grow the size of his farm. This is the second loan Edwin will receive from MFP; he is an enthusiastic person and is happy to work with the community bank. He will use the loan money to buy bags of fertilizer and hire laborers.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and hiring of workers

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Estelvina M. Rojas: es presidenta del comité de Mujeres kuña Guapa de la  zona rural  de la compañía  Caaguy Cupé, distrito de Ybycuí, departamento de Paraguarí.

Este comité se encuentran trabajando desde el año pasado con un un credito inicial de 300.000mil, actualmente estan en el segundo ciclo del prestamo, inicialmente, empezaron con un grupo de 16 personas de las cuales desertaron 3 y ahora se quedaron con 15 integrantes.

Los miembros del comité trabajan en conjunto haciendo actividades de venta de comida, torneo de futbol, boley  para solventar los gastos de pago de cuota, aparte de que los miembros el dinero prestado de la Fundacion Paraguaya utilizan para compra de pollitos, cria de cerdos, ampliacion de almacén  y para utilizar en laa actividades agropecuarias para la siembra de los cultivos para el sustento de la familia durante el año.

Asi la señora Estelvina se dedica a varias actividades en su casa ya que tiene cria de aves y cerdos, y debe trabajar mucho para criarlos para obtener buena ganancia con la venta de los animales.
Ella ademas de la cria de animales tambien tiene su huerta con plantaciones de horalizas para el consumo de la familia y vender los excedentes.
Solicita el préstamo para  invertir en sus actividades como en la compra de pollos, balancelados para cerdos, y otros.
texts.en:
Estelvina M. Rojas is the president of the “comité de Mujeres kuña Guapa” of the “Caaguy Cupé” rural zone, located in the “Ybycuí” district, of the “Paraguarí” department. This group has been active since last year and began with an initial loan of 300,000,000 PYG. They are now in the second cycle of the loan. The group began with 16 people, 3 of whom left, and they currently have 15 members. The committee members work together to organize activities, such as food sales and soccer and volleyball tournaments, to cover the expenses of making their payments. The members also use the money that they borrowed from “Fundacion Paraguaya” to buy chicks, raise hogs, run a store, and to raise crops to feed their families throughout the year. Estelvina does various things out of her home, since she raises poultry and hogs and she must work hard to raise them in order to produce good earnings from the sale of the animals. She also has an orchard where she raises vegetables for sale and for feeding her family. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in her businesses, such as buying chickens, hog feed, and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry, feed, and supplies

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in the city of Multan, Pakistan, famous for its history and warm weather. Her husband is a private entrepreneur who deals in clothing, selling it to different areas of the community. Zubaida stays at home, manages the household chores and takes care of her family. She also helps her husband in arranging the clothes in his bicycle to make it easier for him to display his merchandise. 
 
Zubaida's husband attracts people by making loud announcements about his product. He works 7-10 hours daily, which makes him tired enough. That’s why Zubaida has applied for a loan from Asasah. She will invest the loan amount in her husband’s business so he would be able to buy clothing in bulk and supply it to clothing stores without having to travel to different communities to sell his merchandise. She is hopeful that, in this way, her husband may increase his income and be able to work on a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Abana

texts.en:
Abana F. sells plastic bowls at Takoradi. She has received senior high education and is married with three children. Her husband works in a sawmill.

Abana has been selling plastic bowls for some time now, helping her husband in the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic containers for sale.

Abana hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more plastic containers for sale

loans.name: Patricia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Patricia de 24 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas. Ella confecciona y cose ropa. 

Por la falta de oportunidades ella empezó cociendo a mano las ropas, después pudo comprar con esfuerzo una maquina de cocer. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella trabaja en su casa con su taller de confección de ropa. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm. 

Para seguir produciendo y confeccionando ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas, hilos y botones. En el futuro quiere darle una mejor vida a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera.
texts.en:
Patricia is 24 years old and lives in an urban area called “Las Orquídeas” ["The Orchids"], so-named because when it was discovered, there were many orchid flowers there. She makes and sews clothing. Because of the lack of opportunities, Patricia started making clothes by hand. Through her efforts, she was later able to buy a sewing machine. Since that time, she has run her sewing workshop out of her home. She works from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. In order to continue producing and creating clothing, she wants to use this loan to buy fabric, thread, and buttons. In the future, she wants to provide her two children with a better life, as she is a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Santos Antonia

texts.es: Santos Antonia V. D. R. D. 62 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Vicente, en donD. vive junto a su hija y una nieta D. 5 años D. edad. Santos es una señora la cual tuvo que trabajar muy duro por el bienestar D. su familia debido a que fue madre soltera D. tres hijos D. los cuales dos cuentan con su propio hogar. En la actualidad ella posee un negocio propio en su casa D. habitación en donD. comercializa cilindros D. gas propano. Con el deseo D. poder brindar un mejor servicio, Santos solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. cilindros D. gas, y D. esta forma ella espera aumentar sus ventas lo cual le permita pagarle a una persona para que reparta el gas a sus clientes, ya que ella cuenta con varia competencia la cual brinda el servicio D. entrega a domicilio, por lo que Santos desea seguir adelante en su negocio y así mismo contar con las ganancias que le permiten contar con todo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Santos Antonia V. D. R. is 62 years of age and lives in the department of San Vicente with her daughter and 5 year old granddaughter.  Santos has had to work very hard for her family's well being as she is a single mother to three children, two of whom now have their own house. 

Santos runs her own business selling propane gas cylinders from her home. As she would like to improve her service, Santos is requesting a loan to purchase gas cylinders in bulk and increase her sales, which will give her the opportunity to pay for someone to deliver gas to her clients, as Santos has to compete against other businesses who offer a home delivery service. In this way, Santos will be able to continue running her business and receiving the income that provides her with the essentials to live on.

loans.use: Purchase of propane gas cylinders

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school.  He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and house rent. 

For over ten years, he has operated his retail shop selling sugar, tea leaves and wheat flour to his neighbours. Bakari faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business due to fluctuation of prices of the commodities. In the future he would like to build real estate houses. 

Bakari decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation from the society. With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bags of sugar, rice and beans.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar, rice and beans.

loans.name: Dolores Epifania

texts.es:
Dolores tiene un taller de confección, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Ella trabajaba en un fabrica de ropa y hay fue donde aprendió ha hacer ropa al por mayor pero como quería independizarse y tener su propio negocio compro maquinas de coser y materiales para elaborar ropa. Poco a poco ella a creado ropa y ha incrementado su clientela, trabaja todos los días en su taller con una vecina. Ella hace blusas, pantalones por pedidos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y botones para confeccionar mas ropa, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener mas grande su taller.
texts.en:
Dolores has a sewing workshop and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil, a periurban area located in the mountains with dirt roads and houses.

She worked at a clothing factory where she learned how to make clothes in large quantities. Dolores wanted to become independent and start her own business, so she bought sewing machines and materials for making clothes. Little by little, she began creating her own designs and increased her customer base. Dolores works every day in her workshop with a neighbor. She produces blouses and trousers upon request.

This loan will be used to buy fabric and buttons for producing more clothes. In the future, Dolores wants to finish the construction of her house and have a larger workshop.

loans.use: Purchase fabric & buttons

loans.name: Silvia Carmelina

texts.es:
Doña Silvia es una señora D. 53 años D. edad, vive en El Transito, departamento D. San Miguel con sus dos hijos D. 18 y 22 años D. edad, ella es viuda y posee una tienda que comenzó  por iniciativa propia con sus hijos, el horario D. ellos es D. 6:00am á 7:00pm, su ventaja es la falta D. competencia en la zona.
Hoy doña Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra D. arroz, frijol, aceite, azúcar, gaseosas, y otros productos que le son demandados por los clientes y que necesita tener en su inventario para el momento en que los clientes le lleguen. Con esta inversión ella estará solventado la dificultad D. falta D. inventario a la vez está incrementando la posibilidad D. tener mayores ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Su proyección en la vida es que su negocio no llegue a la quiebra y que al contrario siga progresando y estabilizando los ingresos del hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Silvia is a 53 year old woman who lives with her two children (ages 18 and 22) in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel. She is a widow and manages a store that she started along with her children. Their work schedule is from 6am to 7pm. She is at an advantage because of the lack of competition in the area.

Today Doña Silvia is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, sodas, and other products that are demanded by her customers. She needs to have inventory for when her customers come to her store. With this investment, she will be able resolve her lack of merchandise by increasing her inventory. This will help her generate more income to cover her household expenses.

Her goal in life is to prevent her business from going bankrupt. She would like to continue progressing and stabilize her household income.

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, oil, sugar, sodas, and other products

loans.name: Maria Alexi

texts.es:
María de 26 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive con sus tres hijos en  Guasmo  caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.  

Para cubrir con los gastos de la casa y de sus tres hijos de 19, 11 y 8 años ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal y ropa. Poco a poco ha trabajado  desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 15.00 hasta $ 60.00 c/u, cremas, desodorantes. También vende en su casa los productos con una vitrina que ha comprado. Una de las preocupaciones que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector cuando camina para vender los productos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, crema. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un negocio de ferretería.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old.  She sells Yambal products.  Yambal is a company that offers enterprising women the chance to begin selling their products independently.  She lives with her three children in Guasmo, an area that is noted for the fact that most of its residents are salespeople.

To cover the household expenses and those of her three children aged 19, 11 and 8, María started work selling Yambal products and clothes.  She works from very early in the morning offering her products to neighbors and friends.  She sells perfume, for between $15.00 and $60.00 each, creams and deodorants.  María also sells her products in her home from a display case which she bought.  One of María's worries is the crime in her area when she is walking around selling her products.

María would like to use her loan to buy Yambal products such as perfumes and creams.  In the future, she would like to finish building her house and own a hardware store.

loans.use: To buy perfume and creams

loans.name: Gulbaira Joldoshova's Group

texts.en:
Gulbaira J. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Toktogul. Gulbaira is 43 and married. Her husband works as a school teacher. Together, they bring up a daughter and a son, both of whom are at school. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 KGS, the family started to breed cattle. Reselling cattle after fattening, they earn 10,000 KGS per month. This profit has made it possible for them to purchase furniture and improve the family’s living conditions. With this loan, Gulbaira wants to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, she wants to give her children a good education. 

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit:  www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at  www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela  es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas”  del distrito Huancané,  provincia D. Huancané y departamento D. Puno, tiene 62 años, D. estado civil casada, tiene 01 hio dependientes, realizó estudios D. educación primaria.

Trabaja más D. 01 años con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue D.  S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. granos D. la región, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. ganados.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo crédito D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar  tres unidades D. ovejas, la señora también teje frazadas.

Su sueño es tener un buen ganado para su negocio

Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque intercambian palabras.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the Las Huancheñas communal bank from the Huancané district, located in the province of Huancané and in the department of Puno. She is 62 years old, married, and has one child who is her dependent. She completed elementary school.

She has worked for more than a year with Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her first loan was for 400 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), which she invested in her business selling regional grains. She currently works selling cattle.

She is now requesting a new loan for 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), with which she will invest in the purchase of three sheep. Manuela also knits blankets.

Her dream is to have good cattle for her business.

What she likes about her communal bank are the meetings because they exchange conversation.

loans.use: To purchase three sheep

loans.name: Sabbah

texts.en: Sabbah is the father of two daughters and one son. He and his wife are school teachers and have been saving money to build their own house. Now that they have built the house, they are preparing it so that they can move in as soon as possible. Sabbah came to FATEN to get a loan to finish the final touches on his new house, such as installing sinks and purchasing needed pieces of furniture, such as a kitchen table.

loans.use: to pay for the finishing touches for the newly built house and to purchase furniture

loans.name: Pel

texts.en: The woman the picture is Pel C., 40 years old, who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Pel C. owns a small store next to her house, which is full of people, and she uses this store to sell breakfast and lunch foods. She generates a profit of approximately US$ 2 a day to help support her family’s daily expenses with more stability. Her husband is a horse cart driver in and around his community. This couple has four teenage children. Pel C. will be using her loan to build a new bathroom for the whole family to use because her old one has broken down. That is why Pel C. would like to request a loan from Kiva in order to have her family live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To build a new bathroom for the family.

loans.name: Peter Juma

texts.en:
Peter has been working in his quarry for 11 years.  He is 51 years old, married to Rosemary Achieng, and they have three children.

Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 30,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy tools and pay for manpower.

In the future, Peter hopes to buy his own lorry to transport the stones to different places.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for manpower

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia G. is from the village of Overview, Liloy Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old. Vevencia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Vevencia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Vevencia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vevencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vevencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Vevencia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Vevencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide increased working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of beans, groundnuts and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet K. is 46 years old and married with two children aged twenty-two and seventeen years. She sells secondhand shoes at the Gikomba market which is strategically placed near the city center. For the last thirteen years this has been her primary business.

Harriet has applied for her first loan cycle so that she can expand her business by buying bails of secondhand clothes for sale. She wants to own her own stall in the future and improve her and her family’s lives.

loans.use: To buy more bails of clothes to sell

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en: Mrs. Odgerel is a 41-year-old divorcee who lives with her two daughters and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in their small family house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar. Mrs. Odgerel is a single mother who has raised her children on her own for eight years. She has run a small cafeteria for nine years and employs some of her relatives as a chef and waitress. Mrs. Odgerel has gained a lot of experience in the food service field and has a loyal customer base. She is a self-motivated, hardworking woman. The district’s food service monitoring authorities often pay a visit to her cafeteria. The reminder from the last visit was to replace some kitchen equipment for health and safety reasons. Therefore she is asking for a loan to replace the necessary kitchen equipment, fix some appliances and to do some restoration work in the cafe to meet the local authority requirements.

loans.use: to replace kitchen equipment, fix some appliances and to do some restoration work in the cafeteria to meet local authority requirements

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma Y. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 38 years old. Alma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and spices in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Alma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional spices and vegetables for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Alma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 43 años de edad vive en Barrio Los Pinos con el Sr Ricardo (conyugue) tiene 5 hijos los cuales 3 de sus hijos son mayores de edad y 2 que todavía están a su cargo, la Sra. es propietaria de un taller mecánico ambos trabajan ahí desde hace 10 años. El crédito que solicito la Sra. Es para capital de trabajo (compra de repuesto, empaquetadura de culata, rodamiento, y otros) quedo muy  agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad que se le brindo al otorgarle su primer crédito "manifestó".
texts.en: Mrs. María is 43 years old; she lives in the Los Pinos neighborhood with Mr. Ricardo, her partner. They have 5 children 3 who are adults and 2 are still under her care. Mrs. María owns a car repair workshop and she has worked with her husband in it for some 10 years. The loan is for work capital, to buy spare parts, head gaskets, ball bearings and other items. Mrs. María is very grateful to the institution for the opportunity given to her through this first loan, she said.

loans.use: buy spare parts, head gaskets, ball bearings and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 25 years old and she is married to Onesmus. She operates a school and has been in the business for one and half years, bringing in a profit of KES. 20,000 per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be her first loan. She wants to start cooking food at the school so that the children do not have to carry food that will get cold before lunch time. She plans to use the anticipated profit to build more classes up to class eight.

In the future she hopes to have a complete school. She is a very hard-working lady.

loans.use: to start cooking food at the school.

loans.name: Benkadi  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe BENKADI 1 sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sieurs  etc  à NIARADOUGOU. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, au moins 4 enfants. NIARADOUGOU est un village qui est un chef lieu de commune situé à environ 23 km  de la ville de Sikasso troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles exercent la culture du maïs, du gombo (telle avec SALI) et du poivron,  qui sont des produits vendus sur les marchés de Sikasso et dans d’autres communes de la région. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activités agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a plus de 5 ans. Le groupe est à son sixième cycle de prêt de campagne. Les cinq  prêts antérieurs ont tous été correctement remboursés.
SALI  qui est la présidente de ce groupe, est debout au milieu et tient un enfant,  compte acheter , 2 sacs d’urée et 10 sacs de complexe. Ces intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’ils aient de la valeur avant d’être vendus  au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Les dix femmes du groupe BENKADI 1 sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sieurs  etc  à NIARADOUGOU. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, au moins 4 enfants. NIARADOUGOU est un village qui est un chef lieu de commune situé à environ 23 km  de la ville de Sikasso troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles exercent la culture du maïs, du gombo (telle avec SALI) et du poivron,  qui sont des produits vendus sur les marchés de Sikasso et dans d’autres communes de la région. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activités agricoles, les membres du groupe ont donc décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a plus de 5 ans. Le groupe est à son sixième cycle de prêt de campagne. Les cinq  prêts antérieurs ont tous été correctement remboursés.
SALI  qui est la présidente de ce groupe, est debout au milieu et tient un enfant,  compte acheter , 2 sacs d’urée et 10 sacs de complexe. Ces intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockés pendant un certain  temps pour qu’ils aient de la valeur avant d’être vendus  au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.

loans.use: Pour l’achat des intrants agricole.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Emerita works hard to support her family. She has a meat vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Emerita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy pigs and a cow to slaughter and sell for her meat vending business.

Emerita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to buy farmland.

loans.use: To buy pigs and a cow to slaughter for sale as meat.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture making business.

Carmelita has been in this business for four years. Carmelita earns more income from her sari-sari store.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 9 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, con este negocio lleva varios años dedicándose, pues sus hijos dependen de ella, por lo mismo debe mantener ingresos para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz y gas propano, para elaborar las tortillas. Este préstamo le ayudara para tener suficiente materia prima y continuar atendiendo la demanda.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente para mejorar los ingresos de su familia, manteniendo a sus hijos con todo lo necesario y una vida digna.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her family. She has two children who are 6 and 9 years old.  She sells tortillas.  She’s been in this business for several years because her children depend on her so she must produce income for household needs.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy corn and propane gas to make tortillas.  This loan will help her have sufficient raw materials available to continue to meet demand.

Her objective is to work hard to improve family income to give her children everything they need and for a life of dignity.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas to make tortillas.

loans.name: Mahmadkhuja

texts.ru:
Махмадхужа целеустремленный и честный человек.   Он любящий муж и отец 2 детей. Махмадхужа занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур более 4 лет и у него богатый опыт по данному бизнесу. Весной он сеет семена картошки, лука и морковь, а затем продает их, когда они вырастут. Его жена, дети и невестка помогает ему на переработки земли, и они дружно вместе работают.  Махмадхужа хотел бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки семена, минеральных удобрений и горюче смазочные материалы. Он заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Mahmadkhuja is a goal-oriented and honest person. He is a loving husband and the father of two children. Mahmadkhuja has been growing produce for over four years, and has a lot of experience in this area. In the spring he plants potatoes, onions and carrots, and later harvest and sells them. His wife, children and daughter-in-law help him work the land. They work well as a team. Mahmadkhuja would like to obtain a loan of $3000 to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers as well as fuel and engine oil. He thanks all lenders in advance for their support and encouragement. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and engine oil

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 25 years.  He is 51 years old, married to Waithira and they have two school-going children.  

Geoffrey was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan, which he plans to use buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Geoffrey hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Composé de cinq femmes  toutes mariées, les membres du groupe Benkadi  ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura dans la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce des céréales, chaussures, habits   et avec  RABOUA pour le commerce d’articles divers d’étalage. C’est la seule debout. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et les quatre prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce  prêt RABOUA, compte acheter 2 sacs de sucre et 2 cartons de cigarettes. Elle s’approvisionne à BOUGOUNI et revend sur son étale au quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group consists of five married women who average 40 years of age and four children each. They live in traditional families in the Massablacoura district of the city of BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. 

They sell cereals, shoes, and clothes. Raboua, seen standing in the photo, sells various display items. Eager to satisfy their customers’ needs and bolster their activities, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their fifth group loan. All previous loans were repaid without incident.

Raboua will use this loan to buy two bags of sugar and two cartons of cigarettes. She gets her stock in Bougouni and sells the merchandise in Massablacoura at retail, for cash or credit, to a client base composed of both men and women.

With this loan, she plans to earn a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various display items for resale

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi has been buying and selling fish in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  She is 35 years old, married to Kennedy, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more fish to sell.

In future, Naomi hopes to grow her business and become a leading supplier of fish and fish products in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah is 52 years old and married to David. They have one daughter who is 18 years old.

She has a bricks business and has applied for a loan to enable her to buy more bricks to add to her stock. Juliah will use the profits made to provide for her family's needs and pay college fees for her daughter.

Juliah hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more bricks

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a hog raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. She started her business with five pigs for fattening. When she got expert with the business, she continued it with one sow until it produced many piglets when it gave birth. There was also a time that she was hopeless when her sow gave birth and only two were alive. Nena did not lose her hopes. Instead, she continues to operate her business. 

With her business, she was able to send her children to school. Two of her children have already finished their education, and only the youngest is still studying. Now, Nena needs additional working capital for the maintenance of her 25 piglets and eight hogs for fattening. She is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for her pigs.

Nena is looking forward to continued development of her business. She wants to finish her youngest child's education through profits she earns from the business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина снова хотела бы пополнить ассортимент женской одежды для продажи в этом осенне-зимнем сезоне. Она планирует использовать кредит в 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить дополнительно количество кофт, свитеров, курток и юбок, что и побудило ее обратиться за очередным кредитом КИВА.
Прибыль, полученную от вложения в свой бизнес прошлого кредита, Валентина потратила на содержание семьи и реинвестирование в свое дело.
Валентина хорошо ведет бизнес, вовремя делает вложения, добродушная, серьезно относится к обязательствам.
Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Valentina is seeking to once again increase her selection of women's clothing for retail, for the fall-winter season. She plans to use the loan of 8,000 UAH to purchase additional stock of blouses, sweaters, jackets and skirts. This is the reason she is applying for another loan with KIVA. The profit that Valentina made after investing her previous loan into the business, was used for family expenses and reinvested into her business. Valentina runs her business well and makes payments on time. She is kind, and takes her responsibilities seriously.

loans.use: purchase blouses, sweaters, jackets and skirts

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is a diligent father. He is 45 years old, married to Rebecca, and together they raise five children. Romulo has been involved in rice farming for almost 20 years and earns PHP 10,000 during harvest season. Harvest season usually falls during the month of April and November. Profits earned went to electric bills, meals, and daily allowances of his children. 

Romulo is in need of additional capital in buying moluscicides and pesticides (chemicals used to treat molusc and pest that destroy seedlings). He is asking for P15,000. 

In the future, Romulo wants to improve his crop production to earn enough income for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy moluscicides and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Sabina Vargas

texts.es: La señora Sabina, tiene una tienda D. barrio en su mismo domicilio donD. ofrece productos D. primera necesidad, tiene 4 hijos los cuales son independientes ya están casados hicieron su vida, cuenta con casa propia,  donD. se encuentra su tienda  cual esta abierto D. lunes a domingo, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra D. mercadería como refrescos, dulces y galletas para surtir su tienda, la Sra. Sabina es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Mrs. Sabina has a convenience store in her home where she sells basic staples. She has four independent children who are all married and leading their own lives. Sabina has her own home, where her shop is located. She is open for business every day of the week. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise such as pop, sweets, and cookies to stock her store. Mrs. Sabina is a very hard-working person and is happy for the opportunity that we are offering her.

loans.use: to buy sweets and cookies to stock her store.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es una persona trabajadora que  tiene 16 años de estar en el negocio  de ventas  al por mayor de banano y plátano, los cuales trae de la zona del Urabá Antioqueño.  Este es un negocio que   Jorge conoce muy bien,  tienen la zona asignada entre quienes a él se dedica;   su clientela está ubicada en San Jacinto, San Juan Nepomuceno,  El Guamo y otros corregimientos de la zona.  Jorge se dedica a este negocio en unión de su esposa y de  esta actividad  su familia conformada por ellos y sus hijos de 8 y 16 años  dependen económicamente de esta actividad.    
Se inició en el negocio vendiendo banano   cuando transportaba este producto en unos camiones desde el Urabá hasta la Costa  Caribe de Colombia, donde conoció los proveedores y decidió emprender un punto de venta   en San Juan Nepomuceno;  luego fue ampliándolo,   buscando nuevos clientes en otros pueblos como en la actualidad lo están haciendo.
Sus ventas son altas debido a que son distribuidores en la zona que tienen asignada; el banano  y el plátano lo venden directamente a los negocios como tiendas,  restaurantes  y  puntos de venta en el mercado. Sus activos totales están representados la mayor parte por el carro y la moto, vehículos,  muy útiles para la distribución de sus productos.  
 Jorge Está aplicando a su primer credikiva, pero su esposa en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha obtenido 6 financiamientos,  que ha inyectado a su capital de trabajo.  En la actualidad con su credikiva comprara plátano directamente,  garantizando mejores precios que trasladará a sus compradores. Su negocio gracias a los financiamientos de la Fundación ha crecido, ahora cuenta con un vehículo repartidor,  cuatro empleados, un cuarto frio y clientes permanentemente.   Su meta más adelante es ampliar su cuarto frio y diversificar su oferta con productos nuevos como verduras, para continuar fortaleciendo el bienestar de su familia, especialmente lograr estudios de calidad para sus hijos. Su mayor desafío es cuando hay cosechas de frutas que disminuyen las ventas, por eso planea incursionar en productos que reemplacen los actuales.
texts.en:
Jorge is a hardworking man who has spent 16 years selling bananas wholesale, which he gets from Urabá Antioqueño.  This is a business that Jorge knows very well and he covers an area that supplies clients in San Jacinto, San Juan Nepomuceno, El Guamo and other parishes within the area.  Jorge works together with his wife on their business and he and his family (his wife and two children ages 8 and 16) are financially dependent on this.

He started out in the banana sales business when he was transporting this produce by lorry from el Urabá to the Caribbean Coast of Colombia, where he got to know the suppliers and decided to establish a sales outlet in San Juan Nepomuceno.  From there he began to expand, looking for new clients in other villages as he is currently still doing.
