Their sales are high as they are the distributors for the area assigned to them.  They sell banans directly to businesses such as shops, restaurants and retail outlets in the market.  Their total assets are comprised largely of a car and motorbike, very useful for the distribution of their products.

Jorge is applying for his first Kiva loan, but his wife has received 6 sets of funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she has invested into their business.  With their Kiva loan they will buy bananas directly, guaranteeing better pries which he will be able to pass on to his customers.  His business has grown thank to funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, as he now has a distribution vehicle, four members of staff, a cold room and a fixed client base.  His future target is to expand his cold room and diversify his product line to include new produce such as vegetables so as to continue to better his family's well-being, particularly so as to secure a quality education for his children. His biggest challenge is when there are fruit harvests, which reduces sales and for this reason he plans to dabble in other products that could replace his current produce.

loans.use: to buy bananas directly cutting out the middleman

loans.name: Gaggawala Development Group A

texts.en:
This suave, philosophical and good-humored mother of five took the reins in her poultry business seven years ago. Unlike the many young entrepreneurs this lucrative business has spawned in recent years, Hamidah began at a time when the business was not so flourishing.

She has seen a chequered path while bearing a hand in this venture. She says it has not been easy but there have been times when her trade has basked in the glow of success. Though she says there has been a favorable turn in the tide of her business recently, she says there are still many pitfalls to overcome.

However, she says her determination and tenacity have been and will invariably be of paramount importance as her business continues on its trajectory of growth. She says she will use this loan to purchase more poultry to resell. She believes this will at length elevate her business's financial means.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to resell.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio tiene 46 años edad y es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos, él nació en el departamento de Apurímac   pero vive en el poblado de Cotowincho de la provincia de Urubamba, él es albañil pero nos cuenta con mucha triste que hace 14 años que sufrió un accidente donde se fracturo el pie pero después se recupero pero fue por muy poco tiempo ahora la fractura del pie le empezó a molestar afectándole en su rendimiento de su trabajo hasta el extremo de no dejarle trabajar y teniendo que hasta usar otra vez muletas. Florencio es una persona muy trabajadora que a pesar de las adversidades sigue a delante pero se las ingenio para seguir trabajando, él tiene que acomodar su pie fracturado para que no le incomode al momento de trabajar. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. 

En esta oportunidad Florencio requiere el préstamo para comprar medicinas.

Florencio es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba. La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.
texts.en:
Florencio, age 46, is married and has four children.  He was born in the Apurímac department, but he lives in the town of Cotowincho in the Urubamba province.

He is a bricklayer.  However, with great sadness he tells us that 14 years ago he had an accident where he fractured his foot.  He later recovered, but only for a short while.  Now the fractured foot has started to bother him and affect his work performance.  At times it has gone to the extreme of not letting him work, and he even has to use crutches again.

Florencio is a very hard-working person.  In spite of the adversities, he continues on and manages to continue working.  He has to arrange his fractured foot so that it is not a problem when it is time to work.

He has worked for several years, and thanks to the effort he puts into his work it is going very well for him. 

Florencio now needs the loan to buy medications.  Florencio is a member of the Nueva Vision de Rumichaca communal bank.  This group is comprised of 19 members who live in the Urubamba province.  

The province of Urubamba is north of the city of Cusco on the banks of the Vilcanota River.  It is a zone that is known as the “Valle Sagrado” (Sacred Valley) because of its temperate climate, fertile land, and abundant streams.  They make this valley one of the most beautiful on the planet.

loans.use: to buy medications.

loans.name: Alan Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Alan Eduardo es casado,  tiene 22 años de edad, cursó los grado de educación diversificada, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la prestación de servicios de transporte a estudiantes del lugar donde vive hacia otros lugares de nuestro país, inició este negocio con el apoyo de su padre y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para tapizar su vehículo, para ofrecer mejor comodidad a sus cliente, y como también dar un servicio completo a su vehículo, quiere seguir mejorando y tener una buena productividad.
texts.en:
Alan Eduardo is 22 years old and married.  He has a high school education, and he has one child.

He devotes himself to transportation services for students from where he lives to other places in our country.  He started this business with the support of his father.  So far he has four years of experience.

He is requesting a loan to upholster his vehicle, which will make his customers more comfortable.  He will also have complete maintenance done on his vehicle.  He wants to continue improving and have good productivity.

loans.use: to improve his vehicle's condition for his customers.

loans.name: Jackerline

texts.en:
Jackerline is 33 years old and lives in Congo Town; she is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 20 years old.  All of them are in school and live at home.  Jackerline has been selling used shoes for the past four years.  

She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her friend.  Her favorite part about her business is that of buying.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used shoes for her business.  In future she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more used shoe for her business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
For the past years, Mwanajuma has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of transportation as her major challenge. Mwanajuma dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. The previous loan has been of great help to her life, and she appreciates it, very much. 

With the KES 50,000 of this new loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to resell, like maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Five years ago, Lorena started her business because she wanted to support her husband and to be self-sufficient in order to offer a better quality of life to her children. She sells clothes in the flea market to fulfill this goal. She never imagines that her business would be their only sustenance as it is today, because her husband has been sick since the beginning of this year and he has been operated on twice (gall bladder). Now he is recovering and this is why Lorena is maintaining her family with the income of her business.

Lorena is asking for a loan for $925 USD to be able to grow her business. This loan is necessary because she has many expenses tp pay off because of her husband's sickness. And this is why she needs the working capital. She is confident she will be able to repay the loan in a term of 6-12 months.

ESPAÑOL

Hace cinco años que Lorena inició su negocio de venta de ropa en el mercado rodante debido a que quería apoyar a su esposo y tener su propio ingreso para darle una mejor vida a sus dos pequeños hijos. Nunca imagino que su negocio sería su único sustento como lo es hoy en día, pues su esposo ha estado enfermo desde principio de este año y lo operaron dos veces de la vesícula y esta en recuperación desde hace dos meses, es por eso que Lorena está manteniendo a su familia con los ingresos de su negocio.

Lorena esta necesitando un crédito por $925 USD para poder surtir su negocio, ya que ha tenido muchos gastos por la enfermedad de su esposo y es por eso que necesita capital de trabajo. En caso de verse favorecida por el préstamo piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Zulfiqar

texts.en: Zulfiqar A. owns a market in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Zulffiqar is looking for funding so that he can complete the repairs and beautification of his store. He feels that a nice looking market will draw more customers.

loans.use: To completely remodel his market

loans.name: Olinda Jaime

texts.en:
Olinda Jaime M. is 35 years old. She was born and raised in Namaacha, a Maputo province. She was raised by her parents until she was 11 years old. Olinda attended elementary school until the 3rd grade, when she had to leave her parents home to live with relatives in Matutuíne district. Olinda did not have the opportunity to continue her studies because due to the civil war of 1984, she and her relatives had to move to the district of Boane. In 1987, Olinda married and had 10 children, of which 4 passed away. Since 1999, she has been engaged in the goat sales business. In 2007 she was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by friends. There she learned about the prospects of access to credit. With the loan of 10.500,00 MT, Olinda intends to increase sales volume in order to strengthen her only means of income and sustenance for her family. Olinda’s business has a positive impact in her community because it generates employment for Olinda and provides goat meat to the Boane community.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 5 - Boane Cliente: Olinda Jaime M. Sector De Actividade : Comercialização de Caprinos Valor de Empréstimo: 10.500,00MT (420.00US$) Aplicação de empréstimo: Compra de caprinos Inicio: 10/04/2007 Fim: 31/03/2008 Olinda Jaime M. de 35 anos de idade, natural de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus Pais ate atingir 11 anos. Frequentou o ensino primário ate a 3ª classe e teve que separar-se dos seus Pais para viver com os seus Tios no Distrito de Matutuíne e não teve mais oportunidade de continuar com os estudos. Devido a guerra civil em 1984, tiveram que transferir-se junto com os tios para o Distrito de Boane . Desde do ano de 1987 casou-se maritalmente e tive 10 filhos, dos quais quatro perderam a vida. Desde 1999, vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio de venda de caprinos. Nos princípios de 2007 por indicação de amigas teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA tendo se aproxima a esta para informar-se das condições de acesso ao crédito. Com o empréstimo de 10.500,00MT, pretende aumentar o volume de negocio de forma a fortificar cada vez mais a sua única fonte de rendimento que lhe garante o sustento da sua família. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior nas comunidades porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ela própria providencia carne de cabrito para comunidade de Boane.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Michail

texts.en: Michail uses his small van as a taxi, transporting passengers around his home base of Ivano-Frankivsk or further if necessary. Michail started driving a taxi eight years ago after he finished a time of service in the Ukrainian military. He makes around $35 per day which is enough to support himself and his wife, Evgeniya, and their three year old daughter. Michail is a positive influence on those around him and demonstrates responsibility and a good work ethic. He has requested a loan for $700 to help pay for some maintenance on his taxi. We are grateful for this opportunity to assist him with his business and help keep him out on the road earning a living.

loans.use: Taxi maintenance

loans.name: Banovsha

texts.en:
Banovsha V. is 43 years old, married and lives with her husband and three children in southern Azerbaijan. She and her family relocated here after fleeing Nagorniy Karabakh during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993.

For the last eight years, Banovsha has raised sheep and sold mutton to local people and to traders who do business in the bazaar in the country's capital, Baku. This is a good business to be in because mutton is in high demand all across Azerbaijan, where people enjoy eating meat daily at home and in cafes. Banovsha works hard to meet her family's needs, and believes this is a good time to expand her business to include raising cows and producing dairy products. Buying two cows will cost $1,600; she has saved $400, and has come to us for a loan of $1,200 to cover the balance of the costs.

loans.use: Going to purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Paneta

texts.en: Paneta is the Centre Chief for Moataa Centre. She is 62 years of age and a widow with 5 children and 24 grandchildren. Paneta used to be a teacher, but when her husband died she decided to stay home to look after the family shop. Her two older sons migrated to New Zealand and some of her grandchildren are looking after her and the shop. Through her loans with SPBD she had been expanding her home and helping to support her grandchildren in school. Paneta is very happy and very thankful for this opportunity to receive a loan to help her family.

loans.use: To expand her shop and to renovate her home

loans.name: Muniran

texts.en:
I request a loan of $300 for my husband’s business. He operates a catering company and provides food for various events. The wedding season has just begun here and my husband is receiving a large number of catering orders. However, he lacks the funds to purchase large cooking pots, which he requires urgently in order to meet these orders on time.
I am a mother of five, four boys and one girl. We wish to give them a secure financial future.

loans.use: To purchase cooking pots for catering business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch O. V. is married and works selling pork / beef rice and porridge in front of a school, earning on average around US$ 3/day in revenue. Her husband is self-employed as a goldsmith earning around US$ 7each day in revenue.

Mrs. Touch O. V. hopes to use this loan to invest in her little cooked food business. The remainder is to buy more goldsmith tools to facilitate her husband’s business. (The man with the red T-shirt is her husband who works as a goldsmith; Mrs. Touch O. V. was unavailable.)

loans.use: To invest in her little food business and purchase more goldsmith's tools to assist her husband's business

loans.name: Santo Tomás

texts.es:
Mr. Santo is a merchant that sells cleaning products door to door. His wife works washing and ironing clothes for pay. With the meager income that both jobs generate, they have been able to subsist and make a living for their family. They have three children: a 7 years old girl and two boys, 3 years and one and a half years old.

Santo’s house has a dirt floor and walls made out of zinc sheets. He is requesting the loan as he believes is time to take a new step in his life and give his family a dignified and comfortable home. He wants to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron, in order to build concrete walls for his house. He wants to progressively improve his home. His next goal is to build a concrete floor, as the present dirt one generates humidity -and hence sickness in his children.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Santo es un comerciante que se dedica a la venta ambulante de productos de limpieza. Es casado y su esposa se dedica a lavar y planchar ropa ajena. Con los pocos ingresos que generan ambos trabajos, los dos han podido subsistir y sacar adelante a su familia. Tienen 3 hijos: una niña de 7 años y dos varones, de 3 años y un pequeño de año y medio.

La casa de Santo es de piso de tierra y paredes de láminas de zinc. Él cree que ya es hora de dar un paso más en su vida y poder darle una casa digna y cómoda a su familia, por lo que solicita el crédito. Quiere comprar bloques, cemento, arena y hierro para empezar a levantar las paredes de su casa de concreto. Quiere ir mejorando su casa poco a poco, y su próxima aspiración es ponerle piso de concreto a su vivienda, ya que el piso de tierra genera mucha humedad y enfermedad para sus hijos.

loans.use: Build concrete walls for his house.

loans.name: Amalia's Group

texts.en:
Isabel, Amalia, and Flora are all from the small town of Compañía located one hour outside of Ayacucho in Peru. They have been members of the community bank for 3, 4, and 8 years respectively. The bank has taught them to responibly invest and manage their money.

Isabel is a 39 year old wife and mother of four children. To provide for her family she sells grains in the jungle region of Peru, located an eight hour journey over poor roads from her home town of Compañía.

Amalia is 23 years old. She lives with husband and two children. Amalia grows carrots, and lettuce, which she sells in Ayacucho. She also collects cochinilla, an insect used to make red dyes, and tuna- a type of cactus fruit, from the countryside and sells them in the city.

Flora is a 43 year old widow with four children. Flora grows vegetables, which she sells in the city. In addition, she buys tara, a tree product used to make industrial products, which she sells to intermediaries in Ayacucho.

Isabel, Amalia, and Flora need a loan of 625 USD, which they will invest in buying peas, barley, wheat, seeds fertilizer, and medicine, as well as to increase and better pay their labor force.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Isabel, Amalia, and Flora plan to use their savings to build a home and to educate their children. Their dreams are to move up in the world, have bigger businesses, buy land, and ultimately create a better future for their children.

loans.use: To buy crops and supplies and to increase labor force

loans.name: Tae

texts.en: Tae P. is a longtime member in the program, and she fully paid off her $500 loan in just 48 weeks. Before joining SPBD, she already had an existing business which is a flea market, but she didn’t have enough stocks (inventory). She used her loan to buy good quality handicrafts, and she says it’s all sold out. She is now requesting for another loan to buy more handicrafts for her market. This lady also has a good savings account, which she is preserving for bad days.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (handicrafts) for her flea market stall

loans.name: Nancy Janela

texts.es:
Nancy S. works selling various food and personal products in her own grocery store. She is located in the city of Managua in the district of San Rafael del Sur. Along with her husband she seeks a way to provide their two daughters with the means to pursue their studies.

Ceprodel has been a pillar in her business because it has enable her to take out the loans with which she has bought merchandise. She now urgently needs to acquire more merchandise and for this reason is looking for Ceprodel's support to take out a loan and thus continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica la dama Nancy S. es a la venta de productos varios teniendo su propia pulpera la que atiende con diversos productos como comestibles y personales. Se ubica en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en el cual en conjunto con su esposo buscan la manera de cómo proporcionarles a sus dos hijas las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio por lo que le ha brindado los créditos que le han servido para adquirir la mercadería. La necesidad que actualmente atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir su mercadería y por ello busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener dicho crédito y de esta manera continuar con el mejoramiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick B. is a 58-year-old trader. He is married with nine children. He is quite old with very limited strength, yet he cannot shed his responsibility of caring for his children while they are in school.

It is his daily dream to provide a quality education for his children to give them better lives in the future.

Patrick owns and operates a grocery shop with items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. He wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase his stock of goods.

With an increased variety of stock, he hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of his children.

He belongs to the community group called Decency Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil.

loans.name: Belkin Anabel's Group

texts.es: mi nombre es Belkin R. tengo 22 años de edad, tengo un hijo y soy madre soltera, me dedico a la venta de productos de comsumo popular, tengo 3 años dedicandome a esta actividad, a mis clientes les brindo una atencion especial en un ambiente agradable, trato de mantener todo tipo de mercaderia, en la actualidad no cuento con el capital necesario para poder surtir mi negocio, por eso les pido ayuda monetaria para poder sacar adelante mi negocio y poder alimentar mi hijo.

loans.use: compra de arroz, frijoles, azucar, cafe, pan, manteca, margarina, mantequilla, embutidos, lacteos, frescos, papel higienico, pasta dental, especias, sal, tortillas, harina de trigo y maiz, pollo, huevos,

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthol P., a mother of four children who all attend school, is a fruit seller in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Vannary Suon, is a construction worker and motorbike-taxi driver. Although the family members have a variety of business activities, they still live in an old house. Therefore, Mrs. Chanthol P. has decided to ask for a loan to fix up her house in order to improve their living conditions. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To repair her house in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy B. est mariée et mère de 06 enfants avec 02 autres en charge. Elle souhaite renforcer son petit commerce de crème glacée, activité très rentable en cette période de forte chaleur. Elle envisage en même temps d’acheter et de revendre des tissus teintés « thioup ». Elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et leur assurer une bonne scolarité. <b>Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Amy B. is married and the mother of six children, plus two others, in her care. She would like to bolster her small ice cream business, which is very profitable during this period of high heat. She envisions at the same time buying and reselling dyed "thioup" cloth. She intends to improve her children's living conditions and to ensure the right schooling. She is going to repay the loan all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell ice cream

loans.name: Gloria Genoveva

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Genoveva R. T. tiene treintaiocho años de edad y vive en el caserío La Primavera, distrito de Mache, provincia de Julcán departamento de La Libertad  Perú.
Gloria estudió hasta el cuarto año de primaría lo que ahora equivale a quinto grado, no continuo estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo económica de sus padres.
Se casó a los dieciocho años con el señor Amado Ibáñez Rodríguez con quien tienen cinco hijos de los cuales una hija se casó y los otros cuatro son estudiantes.
Se dedica a la compra venta de animales menores, como conejos y cuyes, también cría cerdos y compra y vende quesos y quesillos.
Con el primer préstamo que le brindo Manuela R. que fue de 300 soles, recuerda que compró cuyes y conejos, devolvió el préstamo en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 soles con los que comprará una oveja y cuyes.  Este crédito será devuelto en cuatro meses.
Pertenece al Comedor Popular Corazón de Jesús de Primavera y al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, es una socia muy cumplida en ambas organizaciones.
Sueña con tener su propio capital y ayudar a sus demás compañeras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Genoveva R. T. is 38 years old and lives in La Primavera village, Mache district, Julcán province of La Libertad state in Peru. Gloria finished fourth year of primary school which is now the equivalent of fifth grade. She didn’t continue studying because her parents did not have the economic resources to pay for schooling. She married at 18 years old to Mr. Amado Ibáñez Rodríguez, they have five children, with one daughter who is married and the other four are students. She buys and sells small animals such as rabbits and guinea pigs, she also raises pigs and buys chese and quesillos (cheese wrapped in banana leaves). With the first loan Manuela R. loaned her for 300 soles, she remembers that she bought guinea pigs and rabbits, and repaid the loan within 4 months. With this laon for S/. 1000 soles she will buy a sheep and guinea pigs. This loan will be repaid over 4 months. She belongs to the Communal Kitchen “Corazón de Jesús de Primavera” and to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Trabajo,” and she is an accomplished member in both organizations. She dreams of having her own money and helping her colleagues.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small animals

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
A married mother raising two daughters, Galina depends on her clothing sales business to make ends meet. She retired from her previous work because the salary was not enough for her to live on. Eight years ago, she decided to start her own business in order to supplement her income. Galina has gained valuable experience over the years and has established a good reputation as a business owner. She understands her product very well and is always fair to her customers and co-vendors in the market. 

Galina has also been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine, having repaid all loans to the company. She has requested an additional loan of 2500 Grivnas, $500, to purchase new clothing inventory for her business. In the future she hopes to make enough extra income so that she can put aside some savings. We are happy for this opportunity to further assist Galina as she works to support her family of four.

loans.use: To purchase assorted inventory

loans.name: Parween

texts.en:
Parween lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married with 4 children. She works in tailoring and has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. When she started her business it was weak, but after working one year she taught her daughter tailoring and they started working hard and supporting the family better. After a few months they found AFSG and she got her first loan and completed her stock. She is furthering her business and repaying the loan with no difficulty and now she wants anther loan.

She requested an individual loan of 42000 Afghans for the term of 10 months to open a shop near her house to attract more customers, make a good monthly income and provide a better future for her children. She is sure that she can continue her business with this loan process.

Parween is happy with this loan process and wants to thank lenders around the world. She wants to say she would like to continue her partnership in the up-coming years.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven is 42 years old and married to Belinda.  They have two children:  Christopher – 21 years old, a college graduate but still unemployed and Carleslie – 18 years old, and currently in her college level.  They are living in a community where livelihood opportunities are available and with helpful and kind neighbors. 

For him to start cultivating their ricefield, Joven is requesting a loan of PHP11,000 that he will use to buy seedlings and fertilizers.  Part of the loan will be used as payment for farm laborer that they will hire to help them during the planting season and as rental fee for the hand tractor.  Part of their expenses is their snacks and food for the whole day's work. 

Meanwhile, his wife is in charge of their hog-raising business to generate additional income to further support the needs of their family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers and pay for additional farm labor and tractor rental fee

loans.name: Dilsa

texts.es: Dilsa tiene 49 años, es madre de 3 hijos, siendo 2 de ellos independientes, vive en la actualidad con la última de sus hijas y con su esposo quien se encuentra mal de salud. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 15 años en las instalaciones de su domicilio, lo que le gusta de esta actividad es estar en contacto con sus clientes con quienes comparte muchos diálogos y hace muchas amistades. Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una muy buena zona y le va muy bien, pero por la salud de su esposo, ella tiene que velar por el sustento de su casa, lo que suele ser una carga pesada para Dilsa, pero el amor por su familia le da ánimos para continuar. Este ya es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy responsable con su grupo y sus pagos. Con el dinero que requiere ampliará su bodega y comprará más productos para surtirse con lo necesario.
texts.en:
Dilsa is 49 years old, the mother of 3 children, 2 of them are independent, she currently lives with the youngest of her daughter's and her husband who is in ill health. She has sold groceries for 15 years in her home. What she enjoys about her job is to be in contact with her customers with which she has many conversations with and has made many friends. This business is very profitable, as it is located in a very good area so it is doing very well. Due to her husband’s health, she has to ensure the livelihood of her household, which tends to be a heavy burden for Dilsa, but the love of her family gives her the will to continue. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and throughout all this time she has proven to be very responsible with her group and with payments. With the money she requests she will expand her store and buy more products as necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase assortment of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Chu

texts.en:
Chu C., 47, is a local farmer living with seven children, all single, in Kompong Cham Province. Her husband, Sok, 47, works as a carpenter, buying wood to make furniture such as chairs, beds, tables, windows, etc., selling them for a reasonable profit.

Since his business is a very important source of income, Chu is requesting a loan for her husband to purchase additional wood for his enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase wood for her husband's carpentry business

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija has been a clothing seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to Wapendanao Group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 35. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, save money for future use, and pay school fees for her child when the time comes.

Khadija is 22 years old, married, and has one child.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van N., 52, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia. She grows and sells rice to earn a living and is able to make US$4 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and typically makes US$3 every day. Van N. wants to take out a loan of US$500 to make a new investment. She will purchase mangos and sell them to the market to make additional profits.

loans.use: Purchase and sell mangos.

loans.name: Botros

texts.en:
Botros is a 42 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capitA. of Lebanon. Botros has owned a grocery store for two years. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He is requesting a loan of $1000 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise, like ice cream, for his store.

This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him diversify his merchandise and expand his stock. When Botros first started his business, he had financiA. issues. He decided on doing his business because he couldn’t find a job. In the future, he plans on improving his store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona P. is a humble and dedicated single mother.  A member of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) in Pandan, Antique, a beautiful town in the northern part of Antique. She joined the organization four years ago to get capital to support her small business.

She applied for this small loan to buy assorted fruits and vegetables to earn income for her only daughter who is with her. She hopes to expand her business by buying in bulk to get a lesser price during market day and get a bigger return when she sells during the other days of the week. She dreams that in the future, her business will grow and she will be able to save for her old age without depending on her daughter.

loans.use: To buy fruits & vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tissue and wood for his furniture building and repair work.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Greetings from Epiphanie Z. , a 32 year-old married woman. She and her husband have 3 children and 1 orphan of following respective ages: 10, 7, 3 and 12 years old. Epiphanie and her family live in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the city capital of Rwanda.

This entrepreneur owns a butcher shop in the Nyarugenge district. Her business is to sell meat.Epiphanie  has 2 workers to help her to run this business well. She has 5 years of experience in this business sector.  She starts working at 5:00 A.M and finishes at 7:00 P.M. Epiphane receives a  profit of $550 per month from this business. She is requesting a loan of 500000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company, a partner of World Vision International.
Epiphanie hopes to expand her business and from the increased profit she intends to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Dominga De La Cruz

texts.es:
Actualmente, en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Dominga D. se dedica a la comercialización  de carne de res, cerdo y pollo en su propio establecimiento donde a diario atiende a sus clientes.

Ella es una dama muy esforzada y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la carne porque requiere adquirirla para comercializarla y por medio de esto, mejorar sus ingresos y la situación de vida de ella y de su amada familia.
texts.en:
Dominga D. sells beef, pork and chicken in the Wholesale Market in the city of Managua. She has her own establishment where she waits on her customers daily. She is a woman who tries very hard. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy meat because she needs to get the meat to sell it. This way she will improve her earnings and the quality of life for her and her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente Est Bonne) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi  de l’association Sérieux sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Koko de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues essentiellement  à travers des liens   de voisinage.
Elles exercent presque la même activité qui est l’achat et la  vente de pagnes wax,  d’habits et des tissus brodés. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité et jouissent d’une grande notoriété. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son sixième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des balles de wax en gros à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali). Ces wax  sont vendus en détail, au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de Koutiala et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 120 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus et l’ouverture d’une boutique  de vente d’habits.
texts.en:
The four women of this group called "Benkadi" (understanding is a good thing), belonging to the "Sérieux" Association, are all married. They have an average age of 35, 4 children on average, live in big traditional extended families in the Koko neighborhood of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know each other essentially because of being neighbors.

They do almost the same work, buying and selling "Wax" brand "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), clothing, and embroidered cloth. They are much in demand in this business and have an excellent reputation.

So as to satisfy the needs of their growing clientele, the Benkadi group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their 6th solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy bales of "Wax" cloth wholesale in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). This cloth will be sold retail, for cash or credit, in the big market of Koutiala and walking around the neighborhoods, to a clientele composed mainly of women. They each hope to make an average profit of 120,000 F CFA during this loan cycle, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan, cover the needs of their extended family, investing the rest in their businesses.

Their ambition is to diversify their businesses by taking on other money-earning ventures and opening a shop to sell clothing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bales of "Wax" cloth

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia E. is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia. She is fifty-five years old and married with three school-age children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a retail shop in the local community where she sells a variety of different products. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Alicia then successfully repaid a loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. In 2009, Alicia decided to join HSPFI again as a returnee, and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan this year from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
Sekina D. M., age 46, is a divorcee with four children ages 26, 23, 18 and 14 years.  She has had a bar business for six years now.  She works daily from 8.30am until after midnight.  She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $752.

This will be Sakina’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes to use this loan to buy more drinks.
\t
Sekina will share this loan with her loan group, Nadia, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Sakina  is at the back in a black and white dress.

loans.use: To buy more drinks.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara A. is 28 years old and the mother of a boy and a girl. She got married early to Arnel, who is 32 years old and a jeepney driver. She lives in the beautiful town of Cardona, Rizal province in the Philippines.

With her determination to bring a better life to her family, especially to her children, Barbara needed to engage in a business that could add support to her husband’s meager income. In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, hoping to have access to capital to start a business. When she received her first loan, she invested it in the resale of frozen foods and, with her next loan and up to the present, she is still in the same business. She likes the business since her product is in demand with families during breakfast as food for their children. She already has regular customers and even receives orders.

Now, Barbara is requesting a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for her resale of frozen foods. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for twenty kilos of pork longganisa (sausages flavored with indigenous spices), twenty kilos of hotdogs, twenty kilos of ground beef, and to pay for transportation expenses. Some will be set aside as rolling capital.

Barbara hopes that with the support of ASHI and the assistance of Kiva lenders, she can reach her dreams: to send her children to school until college; to expand her business; and to set her family free from poverty.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food to sell and to pay for transportation expenses

loans.name: Doniddemberel

texts.en:
Doniddemberel D. is a 45-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in Uvurkhangai in central Mongolia. Her sons both attend high school which means that they cannot help out with their mother's business.

Doniddemberel started her business in 1992 selling firewood and coal in Arvaiheer market located in the center of Uvurkhangai province. Her retail trading business is the only income source for the family.

Through the years, Doniddemberel has gained a lot of experience and expanded her business each year. By doing this, she has made it possible to store 3 - 5 truckloads of firewood and 2 - 4 truckloads of coal to sell at the market. However, she still needs to expand the amount of goods sold in order to fulfill her dreams. She is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to rebuild her firewood and coal storage building and to increase her sales.

loans.use: To rebuild her firewood and coal storage building and to increase her sales

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia D. is from the village of Mambajao in Camiguin Province, Northern Mindanao. She is 35 years old, married and has one school-aged child. Aurelia makes and sells specialty foods in the local community. She has been in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Aurelia joined HSPFI to gain access to their financial services. Aurelia is requesting a loan—her first—of 5000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. She plans to use all additional profits to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her specialty food business

loans.name: Mahmmoud

texts.en:
Mahmmoud is a 38-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Mahmmoud has been working as a furniture and house painter. Mahmmoud is special in his work because his is trustful in his work. His clients are people from and outside his region.

When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as because he wanted to have an independent job, but most importantly because he likes what he does.

Mahmmoud requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase paint for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has repaid on time. In the future, he plans on further improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase paint for his work.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda A., 58, is a rice farmer. She has six children. Her eldest child is 34 years old and married, and is also a farmer. Florenda would like to make her business prosper. Now, she is relying on the income she makes on her farm.

She needs additional capital to run her business. She would like to apply for a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy seeds and other farming necessities.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La señora Ludith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Lleva 07 años, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Ludith, como le dicen de cariño, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Ludith belongs to the Alisson II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 33, in a common law marriage, and has two children. The children, still dependent upon her, go to school. She has been working in this type of activity for seven years. She offers urban transportation services in her “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). Her husband drives it through different parts of the city. She started with her first loan from Manuela Ramos. Little by little, she was saving. With this money she was buying replacement parts to improve the service to the inhabitants of the community. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy replacement parts and oils such as lubricants, circuit boxes, and spark plugs. This way she will offer better service and take much better care of the customers. Today she is an independent woman. She and her husband are the ones who make the decisions and administer her business. Ludith, as she is affectionately called, tells us that belonging to a group of women has helped her to better know her rights. Together they make sure these are respected. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start in the field of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts to improve her service

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.en:
Ozoda is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. Every day she works hard in order to improve her children's lives. For more than 3 years she has sold children's clothing in various colors, styles, and sizes at the local market.  Thanks to her high-quality workmanship and good taste, she is getting more and more orders. Ozoda hopes that her business will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. With this purpose Ozoda requests $1500 USD. She promises to repay the loan on time with no violation. Ozoda is counting on your help. Be an important of the growth of Ozoda’s business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase shop inventory.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie E.'s main source of income comes from providing manicure and pedicure services to local community members. She is 42 years old, married and has six school-age children. They are from Catadman, Ozamiz City. Elsie has been in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 1500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Elsie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aliheydar

texts.en: Aliheydar was born in 1989. He lives in Baku city, and he is single. Aliheydar G. has a cafe business. He has been in this business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy tables and chairs to improve his cafe.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Benadera S. is 47 years old, married and has one son who is 23.  For two years, Benadera has owned and operated a used woman's clothing sales business. Twice a month she travels to Nairobi, Kenya, to purchase clothing and bring it back for sale in Dar es Salaam. Benadera works 8 hours a day and currently earns 400,000 Tanzanian shillings a month (~$298 USD).

This will be Benadera’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes to obtain this loan to increase the frequency of her trips to Nairobi from twice a month to three times a month and, as a result of her increased inventory, improve her business.

Benadera will share this loan with her loan group, comprised of five other women from her community who work in food and clothing sales. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Benadera is in the middle with the red blouse.

loans.use: To Increase her clothing inventory

loans.name: Mercedes Lisseth

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes C. posee una pulpería en su casa de habitación en el departamento de Chinandega,  ella misma la atiende y  es madre de un niño de 3 años.
Este financiamiento ella lo solicitó para comprar mas productos para su pulpería  tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas,  entre otros y así tener mas variedad que ofrecer, anteriormente ella empezó vendiendo bolsas plásticas en su casa.
La señora Mercedes C., lleva con Ceprodel 20 créditos anteriormente  los cuales ha ella le han servido mucho porque ha incrementado su negocio y con este a podido sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Mercedes C. possesses a grocery store in her house in the Chinandega department. She herself attends the store and is mother to a 3 year old boy. This loan that she is seeking is for the purchase of more products for her grocery store, such as rice, beans, sugar, lollies, amongst others, so she can have a greater variety to offer her customers. Señora C. began by selling plastic bags at her house. Señora C. has had 2 loans with Ceprodel 20 previously, which have served her greatly because she has increased her business and with this has been able to improve life for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne W. N. is a divorced, 34-year-old woman. She has a 7-year-old child. She notes that she is a very hardworking, humble, and down-to-earth lady. Her business is located at the shopping center in Thika town, near a bus stop. Thika is the region of Kenya known for its pineapple production.

To earn a living, she sells electronics, including bulbs, cables, bulb holders, and sockets. In addition her her electronics-sales business, she also sells goods like popcorn and hand bags. She explains that she has been in the electronics business for one year now and that this business is profitable. Her major challenge, however, is that some of her inventory does not sell too quickly, which is something she has to manage to ensure that the business runs well. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES ($275) to buy bulbs, bulb holders, sockets, and plugs to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to be an electronics wholesaler, and she also hopes that her son will be educated at the university level.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional electronic goods (e.g., bulbs, sockets, plugs, and cables)

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 34 years old, married to Nancy Gathoni, and they have two school-going children.  He has been selling clothes in a store within Naivasha town for the last two years.

This will be Moses' third loan, after repaying the previous loans well and on time. He plans to buy fabric which he will sell mostly to tailors in the area as it’s in high demand.

He plans to diversify his business and start selling shoes.

loans.use: To buy fabric for sale

loans.name: Narou

texts.fr: Madame  Narou S. est une femme de 60 ans qui habite dans la localité de Ouakam et qui a adhéré  a la caisse de Ouakam depuis 5 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle est bien connue dans la vente de chaussures, tissus, portables, encens.  Elle a démarré  son activité en voyageant sur la Gambie pour acheter des marchandises  , puis vers la Mauritanie pour s’approvisionner en khartoume et en portables. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs dans le but d’aller en Gambie  pour satisfaire une commande de chaussures provenant des amies de sa fille .Madame S. a déjà bénéficié  de 4 prêts  antérieurs  et le crédit va l’aider a satisfaire les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Madame Narou S. is a 60 year-old woman who lives in the Ouakam district and has belonged to the Ouakam credit association for five years. She has run her own business for the past 20 years and is well known for selling shoes, fabric, mobiles and incense. She began her business by travelling to Gambia in order to buy goods, then to Mauritania to source khartoume (fabric) and mobile phones. She is seeking a 200 000 F loan so that she may go to Gambia to fulfil an order for shoes from her daughter's friends. Madame S. has already received four loans, and this loan would enable her to see to her family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her business funding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his brothers' school fees

loans.name: Bertha Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros.
Mariela es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hija, Mariela vende ropa a pedido a amigos y familiares, además Mariela trabaja en una institución.
Mariela necesita un préstamo de 1300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra ropa variada.
Los sueños son tener una empresa de productos naturales y de ropa.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de los Milagros” (Lord of the Miracles). She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a daughter. Mariela sells clothing upon request to friends and relatives. She also works at an institution.

Mariela needs a loan of 1300 PEN to invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing. She dreams of having a business where she sells natural products and clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothing

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong T. N. was born in 1979. She is married with two children who are going to school. She is a farmer. She is raising ten pigs and poultry. Her family has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND).  She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and has repaid punctually. She can save money daily, weekly. So she feels happy. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy five pigs and feed for them.

loans.use: to buy five pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year old married man from Lebanon. He is the sole income provider for his wife and child. He specializes in painting different types of wood furniture and has owned his own painting shop for 10 years. 

He is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to invest in an air spray machine to help with his work. This will be his first loan from Ameen.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in an air spray machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: seeds and farm tools

loans.name: Lia's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four people who live in Leuk Daek village in Kandal province. Mr. Lia P. is the group leader, selected by the other members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. Phy Ngan, are farmers who earn some money from selling fish. Their problem is that their fishing supplies are too old to use.  Therefore, Mr. Lia P. is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net and a battery. He is the father of two children: one attends the local public school, while the other is four years old.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net and a battery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his field and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
Rose Mary is married to a builder;  they  have  five children and all of them are at school.  Currently she doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Rose Mary changed her business enterprise from a food business to a retail shop. She buys her merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping  She plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. She has a retail shop as an additional income. 

Rose Mary sells to all categories of people around the area. She works seven days a week and her business challenges include seasonality, transportation, and thieves.  She depends on this job for a living. She resides in and owns a house which has electricity but no piped water. She is aspiring of educating her children up to university and joined MCDT because she wanted additional capital.    Her greatest monthly  expenses are for food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. is from the village of Brgy. Aggub, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Anita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame E. is married and has three children. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a driver.

Maame sells secondhand clothes and slippers at Takoradi and uses her income to support her husband in providing the basic needs of her family. She will use the loan to purchase more slippers.

With the new revenue that she hopes to earn, Maame plans on buying a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Charllote Ekua

texts.en: Charllote Ekua A. is married to a security man and lives together with her four children. She has received senior high school education. She sells raw maize and makes kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) in Elmina. She uses the income generated from her sales to help feed the entire family. She plans to use this loan to purchase more bags of maize to sell and to cook. Charllote plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize

loans.name: María Judith

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días, el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

Aquí encontramos a la señora María ella tiene 54 años de edad y esta soltera pero tiene dos hijos de una relación que tuvo hace varios años atrás. Ellos a pesar que son mayores de edad aun viven con ella y además estudian en la universidad.

Tiene un taller de costura y un pequeño bazar donde además de coser y vender sus propios vestidos también vende toda clase de artículos de bazar, le encanta confeccionar ropa de mujer, aunque también elabora ropa de niños, trabaja todos los días de 8am hasta las 20h00, a veces trabaja hasta mas tarde por los trabajos que tenga que entregar,  ella compra las telas y los artículos de bazar a un señor el cual le cancela a fin de mes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar telas y otros artículos que se venden en el bazar. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus metas son seguir trabajando y construir otro piso en su casa.
texts.en:
In the La California neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, known as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, the Su Bankito communal bank meets every two weeks.  

Here we find Maria. She is 54 years old and single. She has two children from a relationship from many years ago. Despite being adults, they still live with her and are in college.

She has a sewing workshop and a small variety store, where besides sewing and selling her own dresses, she also sells all kinds of items. She likes to make women's clothing, although she also makes children's clothing.  She works every day from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. Sometimes she works later because of the orders she has to deliver. She purchases the fabric and the store items from a man who collects from her at the end of the month.   

She is going to use this loan to buy fabric and other items that are sold in the store.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes the ease in obtaining loans. 
 
Her goals are to continue working and to build another floor on her house.

loans.use: To buy fabric and variety store items.

loans.name: Léon Serge  Galixte

texts.fr:
homme de 42ans marié et père de 2 enfants agé de 4ans à 17 mois.il se lance dans la vente des pains en 1999 avec un capital de 13000frs. sa recette est de 50000frs par jours.

avec ce prêt il va acheter des pains, du beurre, du paté de campagne,du saucisson sec, du jambon,du fromage.

il reserve un bon acceuil à ses clients,fait une bonne presentation de ses clients.

il veut prosperer car il à de la volante dans ce qu'il fait. il veut que ses enfants aient une bonne scolarisation ainsi que mettre son épouse dans une école de formation.
texts.en:
This 42 year married father has two children aged 17 months and 4 years old. He began selling bread for a living in 1999 with base capital of 13,000 FRS. He now makes around 50,000 a day. 
He intends to use this loan to purchase bread, butter, paté, cured sausage, ham and cheese. He is always very welcoming to his customers. He would like to prosper so that his children can receive a good education, and so that he can also send his wife to training school.

loans.use: Purchase bread, butter, dried sausage, ham and cheese.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio V. S. de 43 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador, el cual siempre ha velado por el bienestar de su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Manuel posee un pick up, en el cual se dedica  a hacer viajes a diferentes partes del departamento de Ahuachapán, mismo lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia. Él transporta frutas, muebles, personas y todo lo que se le solicita, la zona en la cual él se colocada a diario es muy buena ya que es cerca de un centro comercial. Manuel solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo de poder brindarle un hogar más seguro a su familia, ya que él lo solicita para contar con el dinero necesario para hacer un muro en su casa de habitación y así mismo para reparar el techo de su hogar.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio V. S., age 43, is a hardworking gentleman who is always looking out for the welfare of his family, which consists of his wife and three children who are of school age. He owns a pickup truck that he uses for making trips to different parts of the Department of Ahuachapán, the same area where he lives with his family. Manuel transports fruit, furniture, people, and everything else upon request.

The area where he travels on a daily basis is in a nice location near a commercial center. Manuel is requesting a loan because he greatly desires to make his home more secure for his family. The money will be used to build a wall outside of his home and repair the roof of his house.

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a security wall & repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos Alfredo  M. S. tiene 55 anos. Es soletero  vive con los padres y con los sobrinos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo que se llama David de 4 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Carlos trabaja en la bananera como embalador  es decir realizando empaques para que salgan a la venta trabaja desde hace un año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.
Le gusta trabajar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Carlos Alfredo M. S. is single and lives with his parents, nieces and nephews in Ventana, a canton in Los Rios province.  He has 1 son, David, who is 4 years old.  

The members of the Dole 2 V.R.C. work on the Dole banana plantation in Ventana.  Most of the members have worked on the plantation for more than a year and they earn their incomes from the local banana industry.  There are approximately 13 members.  

Carlos works as a packer, boxing bananas in order to make them ready for sale, work that he's been doing for a year.  He buys the bananas from a warehouse in Ventanas.

Carlos is applying for a loan to set up a home-based business.  He will fit out a space and stock it with products to resell.  The loan will help him buy the things he needs immediately.  His dream is to improve his house and meet his goals for the business.  He likes working and playing sports.

loans.use: Home-Based business.

loans.name: Sheyla Alexandra

texts.es:
Sheyla de 47 años, vende pollos listos para cocinar en su casa. Vive con su esposo y tres hijos en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Compra los pollos vivos para prepararlos y los prepara para que esten listo a cocinar, los vende a los conocidos del sector. Su esposo es mensajero y ayuda con los gastos de sus tres hijos que aun estudian. Por la falta de oportunidades de chequeo medio su esposo no ha podido operarse de las vistas ya que se le hace muy dificultoso trabajar con ese problema. Ella quiere dedicar una parte del préstamo a las medicinas que necesita su esposo para seguir con su vista y una pequeña parte para los pollos. 

Sus aspiraciones para el futuro es que su esposo este bien con su salud. También hacer el curso de conducción para comprar un carro y convertirlo en expreso.
texts.en:
Sheyla, age 47, sells chickens ready to cook in her house.  She lives with her husband and three children in a periurban zone, which has all of the basic services.  It is located along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil that is surrounded by a marsh.

She buys the chickens live in order to prepare them so that they are ready to cook.  She sells them to acquaintances in the sector.  Her husband is a messenger, and he helps with the educational expenses of their three children.  Due to the lack of the opportunity to be medically checked, her husband has not been able to have an operation for his eyesight.  It is very difficult for him to work with this problem.

She wants to use part of the money for medicines that her husband needs in order to continue to have his sight.  She will use a small part of the loan for chickens.

Her future aspirations are for her husband to be in good health.  She also wants to take a driving course in order to buy a car and convert it into an express taxi.

loans.use: Medicine

loans.name: Zipporah Kamene

texts.en:
Zipporah K. is 21 years old, single, and the mother of one child. She owns a retail shop in Mandove in Mwingi town where she sells cooking fat, margarine, maize, mung beans, and rice.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. She had never borrowed from an MFI until she came to KADET LTD. This is her second loan. She repaid her first loan without difficulty. Zipporah plans to add more inventory of maize, mung beans, rice, and sugar. In the future, she hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase maize, mung beans, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung P., 50, is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase supplies to manufacture traditional musical instruments. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. P. is a housewife. P. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend $165 US on food, $3 US on electricity, and $45 US on other necessary expenses every month. This is her seventh loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy supplies to manufacture traditional musical instruments

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
YEREDEME est un regroupement de six femmes, toutes mariées, ayant  en moyenne 40  ans, 3 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à NOUGOUME, un des villages de la commune rurale  de NIENA région de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait la cueillette, le commerce de Sounbala et de beure de karité avec ROKIA K., qui   compte acheter avec son  prêt,  35 Kg de beure de karité.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA et  dans les villages environnants. Le beure de karité est revendu au  marché de NIENA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA  qui sera utiliser  pour contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Yeredeme is a group of six women, all married, averaging 40 years old and 3 children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in Nougoume, a village in the rural commune of Niena, Sikasso region (3rd administrative district of Mali).

This is the first time they have worked with micro-finance institution  Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their customers' needs. The women harvest fruits and sell "sounbala" (a condiment used in cooking) and shea butter. Group member Rokia K. plans to buy 35 kg of shea butter with her loan. She obtains her supplies at the grand market in Niena and the surrounding villages. Shea butter is re-sold at the Niena market and to family members, for cash or on credit, to customers who are both men and women. Rokia expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which will be used to meet the family's everyday needs.

loans.use: To buy shea butter

loans.name: You

texts.en: You K., 66, and a widower, is a professional tailor, making US$3 each day in TaK. province. He has been doing this job since 1990. Currently, he lives with his three children, who are working in construction and a garment factory, earning an income of US$4 to US$5 each. You K. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a tailor stand at the local market. Running a tailor stand at the market will earn more money than working from home.

loans.use: To purchase a tailor stand.

loans.name: Karago Basubuzi Group

texts.en: Esteri is a thirty-five-year-old, married woman with five children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a dream of educating her children. She is a market vendor and has been in business for five years and it is still profitable. Her major challenge is the distance from one market to the other and her dream is setting up a retail shop in town. She is a member of Karago Basubuzi group where each member guarantees the other. Esteri needs the loan to buy food to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing food items to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie P. is from the village of Bonbonon, Iligan City. She is 33 years old. Margie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & beverages in the local community.
