Margie's husband is having a motorela or habal-habal services. Margie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Margie is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages

location.town: Bonbonon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Santa Lucia de la cuidad de Caacupe que dista a 17 km de la oficina regional de dicha ciudad.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Lidia F., vive con su marido y sus hijos, ella trabaja como locutora de radio y en sus ratos libres trabaja en venta de comestibles, ella como también sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les están brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva.
Con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras están en el ciclo Nº 2 con sus 12 integrantes.
texts.en:
The women in this group are from the Santa Lucia District in the city of Caacupe, which is 17 km from the regional office.  The president of the group is Mrs. Lidia F..  She lives with her husband and children and works as a radio announcer.  In her free time she sells groceries.  The members of the group are very grateful for the financial support they are receiving from the Paraguaya Foundation and Kiva.

With these funds they are expanding their small businesses and increasing their earnings so they can have a better lifestyle.  The 12 members are in their second year.

loans.use: To buy meat, fruit, bakery goods, beverages and vegetables

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city known for its dairy industry in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She has been living there in the area of Khanpura with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 30 years.  

A talented lady, Azra operates a business making decoration pieces. She has different business contacts in the market and sells them the decoration pieces at a profit. She is a very active lady and is good at her art.
 
Her husband’s name is A. R.; he is a cobbler by profession and makes shoes on order. He takes orders from different shoe-making factories and shoe shops and fulfills their orders on time to earn an income. 

Azra is the mother of three daughters and two sons. Only her eldest son is able to attend school while the others stay at home.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s business. He will buy leather, a shoe-polisher and nails in bulk to be able to fulfill larger orders on time. He has been operating this business for past 10 years and has vast experience in his field. Azra hopes that an investment will improve his business further.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy leather, a shoe polisher and nails for a shoe-making business

loans.name: Love Each Other Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present the members of the “Love Each Other” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000.00 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Hawanatu K. is the leader of this group. Hawanatu is married with one child. Her husband is a businessman and her child is still not yet of school going age. Hawanatu sells rubber bowls, eggs, cigarettes, etc. and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan she is going to buy more inventory in large quantity in order to increase her business size and quality.

loans.use: To buy rubber bowls, eggs and cigarettes in large quantity in order to increase the size and quality of her business

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush K. lives in Yerevan together with her husband, three children and her mother-in-law. She is engaged in retail trade of women's clothes. Her husband is a stonemason. The main income comes from trade, but it is not enough to meet the family needs. 

Hranush has taken out this loan to develop her business. With the requested loan she plans to purchase more clothing and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to pay for clothes for resale.

loans.name: Buntheurn

texts.en: Buntheurn H. is 39 years old, married, and has four children. The family lives in a village of National Road Number Two about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Buntheurn and his wife are farmers. He is in the process of building a new house and is requesting his first loan of $600 to finish the house.

loans.use: To finish his house

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Hermenegilda nació en la ciudad de Mollepata distrito de Anta a 10 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 49 años, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos.  

Hermenegilda es una madre de familia que vive con sus hijos en su casa propia que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe) en el departamento del Cusco. Esta zona se caracteriza por su actividad comercial y el turismo.

Hermenegilda es ama de casa y alterna sus actividades de su casa con la atención de su tienda de abarrotes, ella acomodo una habitación que dé hacia la calle para implementar la tienda. Ya son 8 años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. 

Ha solicitado Hermenegilda a la Asociación Arariwa un crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles para adquirir comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas. Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

Hermenegilda es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia. Hermenegilda tiene como sueño abrir una tienda de ventas en el centro de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Hermenegilda was born in the city of Mollepata, district of Anta, 10 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She is 49 years old, married and has three children with her husband. 

Hermenegilda is a mother who lives with her children in her own home, which has all the basic services (water, electricity and sewage), in the department of Cusco. The area area is renowned for its business activity and tourism. 

Hermenegilda is a housewife. As well as her housework she runs a grocery store. To install the store she made alterations to a street-facing room. They have been in this line of business for 8 years already, and it's doing very well thanks to their hard work. 

Hermenegilda has requested to Arariwa Association a loan of 2,000 soles to buy food such as rice, sugar, noodles and other things. With the proceeds from the sale of the products she will cover the repayment of the loan. 

Hermenegilda is well-known for being a hard-working, responsible woman and a good mother who wants to give her children a better future by improving her family's quality of life. Hermenegilda's dream is to open a retail store in the center of the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy food such as rice, sugar, noodles and other things.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 30 years old and married, with 3 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Celia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other veterinary products for her pigs.

Celia has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling copras (dried coconut fruits).  She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other veterinary products for her pigs

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en:
Rahmatullo has been in the business of cattle ranching for the last 30 years. The breeding business requires a lot of dedication and effort since it requires the strict control of every one of the animals, including feed and care for those that are older. Through this business, Rahmatullo is able to support his spouse and his four children. He is soliciting a loan through IMON International to buy more animals to raise and sell in the market. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Raad

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has two children. Raad has had a barber shop since 2000. He offers shaving and massage services. He has long experience and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. He is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate the furniture of his shop and to purchase additional products. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate the furniture of his shop and to purchase additional products.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 38 years old and married with three children.

Luzviminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

Luzviminda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander, tiene la edad 29 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito comprar los alimentos para engordar sus cerdos  más rápido. El tiene una porqueriza en donde alimenta a sus cerdos con el fin de darles un peso ideal en el menor tiempo para introducir sus animales a la venta del mercado local y lugares aledaños. El quiere generar suficientes ganancias para darle un mejor bienestar a su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alexander, 29, is married and lives with his wife and three children-his family is his priority.  

He plans to buy food with the loan to fatten up his pigs faster.  He has a pig sty where he feeds his pigs so that they can reach their ideal weight in the least amount of time.  Thus he can take his animals to the local market and surrounding places to sell.
He wants to earn enough to give his family a better life.


This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He hasn’t had any loans with state banks before but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy food for his pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ongechi

texts.en: Ongechi is a hardworking businessman. He is married but has no children at the moment. For the last 4 years, he has been running a welding business in order to make a living. In the next 5 years he wants to have opened up another shop in the town centre. His dream is to acquire a piece of land and develop it. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more metal for welding. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy metal for welding

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 18 years.  She is 42 years old and married to Joseph.  They have six children who all attend school.  

Agnes was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and on time.  She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Agnes hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 41 years old, single, and a mother of two children (20 and 10 years of age). She runs a beauty salon and she has been in business for 11 years. Currently, her monthly income from the business is KES 20,000.

Loice is borrowing a loan of KES 70,000, with which she plans to purchase salon equipment and materials for hair dressing. She plans to open another salon business in Eldoret town with the anticipated profits from the business.

This is her fifth loan and she has successfully repaid her previous loans. Her hopes and dreams are to continue with her salon business, to buy a matatu (private minibus) for public transportation and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and materials for hair dressing.

loans.name: Angel Gilberto

texts.es:
Angel hace 10 años compro un Televisor para alquilar play station y vender cd y ademas a su negocio le agrego la venta de bebidas y sanck para los clientes. Poco a poco fue generando dinero el pequeño negocio que ubico por eso ahora labora de 8:30 hasta las 21:00pm de lunes a domingos ya que le ha ido muy bien prestando los servicios. 

Unas de sus diicultades es que no haiga luz Angel esta casado y su esposa es ama de casa y tiene hijos pero ya mayores de edad. Unas de sus metas es comprar mas Televisores para su negocio
texts.en: Ten years ago, Angel bought a television so he could rent Play Station and sell CDs.  Also, for his customers, he added snack and beverages sales to his business.  Slowly, his business generated money.   Now he works from 8:30 am until 9:00 pm seven days a week as things have been going well for him.  One of his challenges is that he doesn't have electricity.  Angel is married and his wife takes care of the household chores.  He has children but they are now adults.  One of his goals is to buy more televisions for his business.

loans.use: purchase CDs and movies.

loans.name: Yormuhammad

texts.ru: Ёрмухаммад умный и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Ёрмухаммад занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он сеет пшеницу, а потом продает на рынке. Кроме этого он занимается купля продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он начал данный бизнес с одного скота, а в настоящее время у него двух голов  коровы с теленком.  Ёрмухаммад хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки селитры и аммофос для того чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Yormuhammad is a smart and honest man. He is married and is a loving father of three children. Yormuhammad grows agriculture crops. He mainly sows wheat and then later sells it on the market. Also he does buying and selling of large horned cattle. He started this business from one animal and now has two heads of cows and one calf. Yormuhammad wants to receive a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to purchase nitrate and ammophos to collect a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase of nitrate and ammophos.

loans.name: Tawfig

texts.en:
Tawfig is a young man who is 26 years He is living in Sana'a and was recently married. He is a university student, studying in the  Accounting Department, the Faculty of Commerce and Economy,  Sana'a University. 

Tawfig's main business is a stationary and mobile accessories store based in the southern part of Sana'a. He started his business a year ago in a very intelligent way. That is, as he owns a house, he has a tenant with the same activity (stationary) who paid him the rent of some months in stationary materials. Tawfig collected those materials and purchased some more mobile accessories and started his independent business. Now, Tawfig has many clients and his income improved.  When he is at university, he places his younger brother in the business.

Tawfig wanted to expand his business but he didn't have the financial capacity. He took this first loan from AMB and repaid it successfully. Then he took this loan, which is the second loan amounting to 100,000 Rials in order to purchase stationary supplies and phone accessories to meet his clients' demands.

In the future, Tawfig hopes to expand his business by opening a supermarket as well as to establish an independent business for his younger brother.

loans.use: to purchase stationary supplies and phone accessories

loans.name: Ma. Petronila

texts.en:
Ma. Petronila is 49 years old and has five children. Three attend school and the rest have settled into marriage. To generate an income, she sews school uniforms, tablecloths and curtains. She had been doing it for 10 years and earns about P7,000 monthly. 

Ma. Petronila is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy thread, needles and fabrics to use in her sewing service. She wants to improve her services to acquire more customers and earn more profits, too.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles and fabrics to use in her sewing service.

loans.name: Mari Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Mari tiene 35 años de edad y se dedica a la caficultura, cuenta con una experiencia de 10 años en el manejo y cultivo del café, esta es la fuente de ingresos anuales para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Mari es madre soltera, también cuida de sus padres.
El credito lo utilizara para comprarse un panel de energial solar y poder alumbrarse por las noches,en la comunidad donde reside no se cuenta con este servicio básico y toda su vida se ha iluminado con candiles y velas los cuales son dañinos para la salud.
gracias a este panel de energia solar mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mari is 35 years old.  She is a coffee grower and has 10 years experience in managing and growing coffee.  This is her source of income with which she covers her family expenses.

Mari is a single mother and also cares for her parents.  She will use her loan to buy a solar panel so that she can light up her house at night.  In the community where she lives they do not receive this basic service and, her whole life, she has lit her house with oil lamps and candles which are harmful to her health.  Thanks to this solar panel, she will improve her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Juntos Por Un Mañana Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Juntos por un mañana” está conformado por 16 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran peluquería, preparación de comida rápida, pastelería y venta de ropa nueva. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Rancagua. 
Patricia integrante y delegada del grupo del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, cerca de la ventana, su cabello es rubio y usa anteojos. Se dedica al rubro de la pastelería desde hace dos años, comenta que realizó dos cursos de repostería y lo que comenzó como hobby se convirtió en su trabajo. 
Actualmente prepara sus productos desde su casa, los ofrece y sale a vender a las casa de sus clientes. 
Sus ingredientes los compra en distribuidoras y el mercado, todas las semanas.
Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado en horario flexible y sus clientes le hacen hartos pedidos de tortas, kuchen, pie de limón. 
Con el crédito comprará materiales, específicamente cremas, manjar, huevos, harina, blondas y cajas para decorar.
La meta para su negocio es tener una pastelería.
Patricia vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijas de 18 y 10 años de edad. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para aumentar sus ingresos y con esto acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. También se siente muy cómoda con la acogida que le brindó la institución al participar. Comenta que el grupo del cual forma parte existe mucha confianza, respeto y son muy unidos. 
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Together for Tomorrow". It is made up of 16 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, including hair styling, preparing fast food, pastries, and selling new clothes. All of them are from the city of Rancagua. 

Patricia is a member and delegate of the communal bank, who is in the last row in the photo close to the window. Her hair is blond and she uses glasses. She has worked with pastries for two years. She remarks that she has taken cake decorating classes and what was once a hobby has become her work.  
 
At present, she makes her products at home. She offers them and sells them in her customers' houses. She buys her ingredients at distributors and in the market, every week. She works Mondays through Saturdays with a flexible schedule and her customers make many orders for cakes, kuchen, and lemon pie.   

With the loan she will buy materials such as cream, dulce de leche, eggs, flour, paper doilies and boxes for decoration. Her business goals are to have a pastry shop.  

Patricia lives with her husband and two daughters, aged 18 and 10. Her dreams are to keep working and increase her income to have a better quality of life for her family. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has offered her. This has allowed her to invest in her business. She also feels very comfortable with the opportunity institution has offered her to participate in.  She remarks that with the group she belongs to, there is a lot of trust and respect and they are very close. 

Rancagua belongs to the region of the liberator Bernardo O´Higgins. It is a modern city that regulates the main productive and exportation processing of  Chilean fruit and winery. It is also a mining city, because in its mountains is the largest underground mine in the world, “El Teniente”, with 4.500 km. of tunnels.

loans.use: to buy materials, specifically cream, dulce de leche, eggs, flour, paper doilies and boxes for decorating.

loans.name: Ma. Rochel

texts.en:
Ma. Rochel is 32 years old and married with 2 children.

Ma. Rochel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her sari sari store. Ma. Rochel has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Rochel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her sari sari store

loans.name: Risa

texts.en:
Risa is 40 years old and married with three children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 10 years.

He was introduced to KADET by another registered client in his abode. This is his third loan which he plans to use to purchase farm materials, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also animals (cows and goats) for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to plough back into farming and parts to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to higher level of education. He believes that he is a hard-working man who can achieve a lot more with financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also to buy animals for fattening

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She works in the fish industry, selling fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Marina hopes to expand her business in her locality.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elder

texts.es:
Elder, de 29 años, es una hombre amable, bueno y muy trabajador. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 06 y 02 años, él vive junto a su familia en casa de su hermana. Todos los días se esfuerza mucho para así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Elder consiste en el transporte de pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Desde muy temprano sale en busca de sus eventuales clientes a quienes brinda un servicio de calidad y con calidez humana, adicional a la seguridad. Pues él como un transportista responsable tiene siempre en regla su documentación y esta al pendiente de las fallas que pueda tener su vehiculo para la satisfacción de sus clientes. Cuando se inicio en este trabajo manejaba una mototaxi de manera de alquiler, esto no le producía muchos ingresos y por lo mismo no estaba contento haciendo esa actividad, ahora pudo comprar su vehiculo y trabaja para él mismo. Lleva 6 años trabajando de manera independiente y le esta yendo muy bien. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues se distrae, divierte y sobre todo genera ingresos diarios para su familia, además que tiene un gran apoyo de su conviviente, quien se encarga de vender algunos productos en la vereda de su casa y significa un ingreso adicional a su economía. Ahora piensa continuar con la expansión de su negocio y aumentar mercadería. Este será el cuarto préstamo con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado realizará el arreglo o cambio de algunas piezas de su mototaxi, además comprará frutas y abarrotes para seguir con la venta desde su hogar.
texts.en:
Elder, aged 29, is a good kind man and a hard worker. He lives with his partner and they have two children, aged 6 and 2. He lives with the family, in his sister's house. Every day he works hard to offer his family a better quality of life. Elder's work consists of transporting passangers in and outside the city. He sets off very early to look for customers, and he provides them with good service and a warm reception, as well as the security of taking a moto taxi. As a responsible transport operative, he always has his papers in order, and he depends on having a vehicle that customers are happy to ride in. When he started out in this business, he used to rent a moto taxi, but he was not happy with that and it was hard to generate much of an income. He has since been able to buy his own vehicle, and has been working independently for 6 years now. It is going well. He likes his work a lot, because it is interestinig, it can be fun, and above all it generates income for his family.

Elder is also ably supported by his partner, who sells various different products from the sidewalk outside their house to bring in additional income. Now she plans to expand what she sells and carry a greater range of products. This will be Elder's fourth loan with MFP. He is very happy knowing that he can access this financial support, because it gives him confidence that he can continue in his business. He promises once again to make his repayments on time, as he did on the previous loans he had. Also he is grateful to be part of his communal bank, because he says that its members are all very responsible people who pull together. With the sum he is seeking he will repair or change parts of his mototaxi. He will also buy fruit and vegetables to sell outside his home.

loans.use: To buy parts for his moto taxi, and also to buy fruit and other produce for his partner to sell.

loans.name: Khonbi

texts.ru: Хонби замужем и имеет двух детей. Она трудолюбивая и  добрая женщина. Она начала свой бизнес с большим трудом. Раньше у неё не была скота и средств для нормального содержания семьи, она вынуждена была уехать в Россию на заработки, а потом через год вернулась с хорошими заработанными деньгами. Затем она решила заниматься скотоводством и закупила скот на эти деньги. Вот уже более 6 лет она занимается этим бизнесом. Данный момент она нуждается в покупке корма для скота с целью расширения бизнеса и улучшения  домашних условий.
texts.en: Khonbi is married and has two children.  She is a hardworking and kind woman.  She started her business with great difficulties.  Previously, Khonbi did not have livestock and had no means to support her family well.  She had to go to Russia for work and then returned a year later with good earnings.  Khonbi then decided to get involved in animal husbandry and purchased livestock with her earnings.  She has now been involved in this business for over six years.  Currently, she needs to purchase fodder for livestock in order to expand her business and improve her household conditions.

loans.use: to buy fodder for cattle

loans.name: Fredinard

texts.en: Fredinard is married to a petty trader. He has 7 children. He uses his income to help his wife pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a middle high school graduate, Fredinard currently sells provisions in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe).  With over 10 years of experience in this trade, Fredinard sees an opportunity to expand his enterprise further. Nevertheless, he does not have the working capital necessary to increase his quantity of stock. Thus, his loan will be used to buy more biscuits, tins of fish, sachets of Milo, tins of tomatoes, assorted soaps, and indirectly helping him boost his overall sales. Fredinard wants to make his business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, he plans to channel the new profits from his expanded business back into his provision enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, tins of fish, sachets of Milo, tins of tomatoes, assorted soaps, and indirectly helping him boost his overall sales.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel lives in Hoima, Uganda. He operates a retail shop, mainly of sugar, salt and soap, among other items. He gets additional income from farming. He is 36 years old and married with four children, and all attend school. 

He hopes to expand and develop his business and also build his residential house. 

Emmanuel will use the credit to buy more stock like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Julienne est une femme travailleuse et courageuse de 41 ans, elle est mariée.  Le mari travaille comme soudeur dans une société. Le couple a 3 enfants de 12 à 20 ans et ils sont tous scolarisés.
Les activités de Julienne sont très diversifiées : gargote, vente de légumes, petite épicerie.  Elle a deux années d’expérience dans ces activités. Le lieu de vente se situe à son domicile (héritage) . La gargote est une activité héritée de ses parents. Avant de développer ces activités, elle était ouvrière dans une entreprise franche.  
Les revenus tirés de ces activités ont permis de compléter le salaire du mari et de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, notamment, l’éducation des enfants. En  effet, deux de ses enfants poursuivent leurs études à l’université, le dernier est en classe de troisième dans une école privée.  Elle prévoit de construire un point de vente en brique pour des raisons de sécurité.  Son rêve est d’avoir une autre maison autre que celle héritée de ses parents.

loans.use: acheter des légumes et fruits, mixeur, glacière, farine, sucre, huile, café en poudre, lait, maïs, viande, ....

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
C. Va is a loving mother of three children who is excited about the opportunity to provide them with a better life. She currently runs a small business of selling Chinese noodles and coffee. She her current sales total about $2.25 per day with expenses of $1.50 per day, for a net income of about $0.75 per day. C. Va is applying for a loan of $1,000 dollars in order to purchase a bigger shop to sell her noodles and coffee in. This will allow her to make her business more established, and thus provide the opportunity for increased business.

C. Va's two older children also help to support the family income. Her oldest son works in a factory and earns a salary of $120 a month. Her daughter works for a local company and earns a salary of $70 a month. Her youngest son is still attending school. In the future C. Va would like to continue to expand her shop, and she would like to make it a very strong and successful restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase shop to sell Chinese noodles and coffee.

loans.name: Shafahet

texts.en: Shafahet is a low-income person from Agsu district. He is 35, married and has 2 children. In 2001, he started his business with his own resources and in 2005-2006 he borrowed 3 loans from Normicro Agsu branch amounting $200-$400-$700. Now he would like to borrow $1200 to repair the shop and expand the business.

loans.use: rehabilitate the shop

loans.name: Bilhatu

texts.en:
Mrs. Bilhatu Y. N. runs a knitting shop in Maraba community. She has been in the business for over 5 years. Her experience has enabled her to train over 100 women in knitting. These women now have their own shops that are running successfully.

Mrs. Bilhatu is married with 6 children and 3 dependents. Her husband is a worker in a private company. Mrs. Bilhatu has been working very hard through her knitting business and she earns about N10,000 ($80) a week. It has enabled her to support the family in terms of school fees and feeding them. She has been able to support her husband and to build their own house.

She is part of the group Kauna 1 Maraba which has 8 members in total. They will distribute the loan amongst themselves as dictated by their business plan.

loans.use: Knitting - personal business and training others

loans.name: Melon

texts.en:
Melon is a single mother with four children in her care. She comes from Mbarara district in the western part of Uganda. Currently, she lives in one of the suburbs of Kampala known as Nsimbiziwome. Before Melon joined LiA life was not easy for her, especially having to raise children as a single mother. She chose to work cooking food for Indian couples. The time came when her Indian employers left the country and went back to their home country.

With the wages she had saved, she decided to start a small salon business in 2005. The business has been going well and it enables her to generate a little income to feed her children and also cover her other family bills. From this business, Melon generates a profit of 150,000 Ugandan shillings. Melon is requesting a loan of 250,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD150) to add to her savings of 50,000 shillings to be able to expand her business. With this money, she hopes to buy some more salon machines and also a few salon supplies to be able to attract a larger number of customers and also cater to them efficiently and effectively.

She expects to earn a profit of 250,000 shillings per month since she is going to work together with one lady who is a beautician and a young male who is responsible for male haircuts and treatments. She hopes to repay this loan in four months.

LOAN BUDGET:

Buying a hair cutting machine, costing 100,000;

Buying 1 sitting chair, costing 50,000;

Buying a small hand dryer, costing 30,000;

Buying 2 customer chairs, costing 50,000;

Buying rollers (4 packs), costing 10,000;

Buying a smoother, costing 50,000;

The total cost will be 290,000.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Mrs. Susan K., 26, lives in Dholko, Kathmandu, with her husband and two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 6 and her son is in primary school.

Her husband, Mr. Nigam K., returned from Dubai and now he has no work here. Mrs. K. decided to open a grocery shop in her house to overcome the economic problems of her family. She hasn't had enough money to buy goods for her shop, so she seeks a $150 loan to buy some.

She wants to sustain her family with her income.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.id:
Ni Ketut S. and her husband, I Ketut Naku work as contract labor. The construction downturn makes her family's earnings low and uncertain. She tried many professions from gardener to transport labor but still cannot earn enough to fulfill her family's needs. However, Ni Ketut S. didn't give up easily. To solve her problems, Ni Ketut S. started a breeding and fattening pig farm. She is applying for a loan to be used for purchasing a breeding pig, growing piglets and feeds. She chose this business, as her calculation showed that farming slaughter pigs (slaughter cycle of 3 month), has fast cash cycle. So she can pay back the loan on time and supplement her family's income. From the profit, she plans to continue increase her farm population.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Ketut S. beserta suaminya I Ketut Naku, berprofesi sebagai Tukang. Sepinya pembangunan mengakibatkan pendapatan keluarga yang minim dan tidak menentu. Berbagai pekerjaan sempat ia jalani mulai dari pengolahan kebun hingga kuli panggul. Tetap saja tidak bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Tetapi, Ni Ketut S. tidah mudah berputus asa dan menyerah. Untuk mengatasi semua permasalahan hidupnya, Ni ketut S. membuka usaha memelihara babi induk dan penggemukan. Walaupun dengan dana pinjaman, ia manfaatkan untuk membeli induk , bibit penggemukan dan sekaligus untuk membeli pakan ternaknya. Usaha ini dipilihnya karena perhitungannya dengan memlihara babi jenis babi guling ( 3 bulan panen ), perputaran dananya cepat sehingga ia akan dapat mengembalikan pinjaman tepat waktu dan bisa juga disihkan untuk keprluan keluarga. Dari keuntungan usaha tersebut ia berencana untuk terus meningkatkan populasi ternaknya.

loans.use: Purchase breeding pigs and pig feeds

loans.name: Mouk

texts.en: Mrs. Mouk S. H., 31, is married and lives with her husband and four school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  She runs a stand at an open-air market selling a variety of fresh vegetables, making on average $4.80 /day in revenue.  Her husband works on his rice paddy growing rice crops and some kinds of vegetables, earning around $3.33/day of income.  Mrs. Mouk S. H. is humbly requesting a loan amount of $800 to purchase more vegetables to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to expand her inventory

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en: My name is Parveen A. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am the mother of six children, four sons and two daughters. My husband repairs cars for a living, and two of my sons are also in this line of work. We are applying for a loan to buy several items we need for this business. I am also trying to help a few women who are my neighbors and members of my loan group. Like me, they are all committed to establish a good life for their families. I have been their group leader for last two years, and we have always repaid loans on time. The members are: Sughran B., who needs a loan for her husband’s electric store; Jameela B., who needs a loan for her husband’s car-painting business; Shamim B., who needs a loan for her son, who is a carpenter; and Tasleem K., who needs a loan for her husband’s grocery store.

loans.use: To expand various family businesses

loans.name: Esperanza Y Fe Group

texts.en:
This committee of 17 dedicated women entrepreneurs is located in the San Pedro neighborhood, in the city of Encarnación. Each woman owns her own business and they come together for required weekly meetings to discuss their businesses, the successes and failures. As a committee of women, they are bound to each other when they ask for loans as a whole group. At the weekly meetings the women are expected to pay their loan payments and this serves as a support system for the women.

The businesses of these women include: grocery stores, hair salons, tailor shops, clothing, jewelry and cosmetic sales, and different food products. Each of these business women will use their portion of the loan to buy the goods needed for their specialty, and they are each responsible to one another to make payments on time.

loans.use: These women all own very different businesses and the loan will be used to buy different products including clothing,  cosmetics and skin products, jewelry, hair products, ingredients for baked goods, canned goods, rice, flour, pasta, refreshments, fabric, linen, thread, buttons, elastic and to buy various types of seeds.

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.ru:
Zaynab A., 57, lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is a widow with three children. Zaynab has a secondary school education and makes her living in animal husbandry. She raises cows and sells their milk, which gives her an income to support her family. She sells the milk in Dushanbe (Tajikistan's capital) at reasonable prices, supplying the local population with fresh milk. Zaynab would like a loan to buy another cow, which will increase her income. She plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Азизова Зайнаб проживает в городе Турсун-заде.Возраст57 лет. Вдова, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит коров молочной породы, для того чтобы продавать получаемое молоко. Это дает возможность получать доход и обеспечивать свою семью. Молоко реализует в городе Душанбе по доступным ценам. это помогает обеспечить население свежим молоком. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить еще одну корову, что даст возможность увеличить доход.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Chrok

texts.en: Mrs. Chrok C., age 31, is a mother of four children and works selling Khmer cake, which is made from banana, earning around $1.50 a day of profit. Her husband Mr. Chon Nith, 38, owns a plot of farmland growing rice normally, making around $2.50 a day. To make the crops grow faster he needs a  loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizers to put on his farm and the leftover will be used to buy wood to install in his house. (Mr. Chon Nith is pictured because Mrs. Chrok C. is not available)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and renovate the house.

loans.name: Tohirman

texts.id:
Tohirman, who lives in Gatot Subroto street has a profession as used tire rubber sales. He and his wife daily buy used tires that could not be used any more, then cut into pieces using special equipment. The cut rubber is then rolled, and every 3 or 4 days brought to building or furniture stores who are already their customers. Sometimes the buyers also directly picked up in their house. Those cut rubber are usually used as string for sofa, furniture, springbed, etc. Tohirman hopes this loan could be used to add capital to buy used tires. Expected profit will be used to pay for family expenses, and schooling for their two children: Lilik and Milatun.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Tohirman, yang bertempat tinggal di Jl.Gatot Subroto berprofesi sebagai penjual karet ban bekas. Dia bersama istrinya sehari-hari membeli ban bekas yang sudah tidak layak pakai kemudian dipotong-potong menggunakan alat khusus. Karet yang sudah dalam bentuk potongan kemudian digulung dan setiap 3 atau 4 hari sekali dibawa ke toko bangunan atau mebel yang sudah menjadi langganannya. Kadang juga pihak pembeli yang datang mengambil langsung dirumahnya. Potongan karet ini biasanya dipakai sebagai tali untuk kursi sofa, mebel, springbed, dan lain sebagainya. Tohirman berharap dari pinjaman kali ini bisa dijadikan tambahan modal usaha membeli ban-ban bekas. Keuntungan yang nantinya dia dapat bisa untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga dan menyekolahkan kedua anaknya, yaitu Lilik dan Milatun.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en:
Zarifa Mahmudova Zarifa is 22 years old. She and her husband are raising two children. Zarifa’s children are small now, but she is already working hard to ensure the best future for them.

Zarifa is a farmer. She and her husband have 2.0 hectares of land where she grows wheat, rice, carrots, and other crops. She also raises cattle. As a rule Zarifa and her husband grow enough to feed the family and sell the surplus.

With the loan she hopes to receive from IMON Zarifa hopes to produce a bumper crop that she can sell in the market at prices attractive to buyers. She is asking for a loan of 990$ US dollars over a term of 7 months. Zarifa would use most of the loan to buy fertilizer and other supplies to amend the soil and some of the loan to buy calves. Zarifa thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and livestock

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio P. has a business selling mobile telephones in the area.

He started his business two years ago with financial support from his parents.

Thanks to his business he has been able to continue his university studies. Despite his young age, José is a very enterprising person.

He started this business after identifying local demand for mobile phones and the need for people to travel to the next town to buy one.

Given constant changes in cell phone technology, José needs a loan to invest in acquiring more products.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El señor José Antonio P. tiene un negocio de venta de aparatos de teléfonos móviles en la localidad.

Su negocio lo inicio hace 2 años, con la ayuda económica de sus padres. Gracias a su negocio el ha podido continuar sus estudios universitarios, a pesar de ser muy joven, es una persona muy emprendedora.

El empezó este negocio aprovechando la necesidad de que las personas de adquirir teléfonos móviles, y muchas de ellas tenían que trasladarse a otras localidades para obtenerlos.

El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en más productos, ya que este negocio requiere de mucha inversión, por los constantes cambios en la tecnología.

loans.use: Purchase of cellular telephones for sale

loans.name: Irna

texts.en:
Irna is a 24 year old woman from the village Tojsici, near the town Kolesija. She is married with one 2 year old child. Her husband works, but his income is less than $400 USD a month, and this is not enough to meet their monthly living expenses. As such, Irna has decided to start her own business selling cosmetics through Avon.

She will use this loan to buy a good selection of makeup, lotions, face creams, and other products to sell around town. Initially, Irna will save part of her loan to make sure that if these sales don’t work out she can invest the money in something else more profitable. If sales do well in the next few months, Irna will invest the remainder of the loan in buying more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To start a cosmetic sales business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with a teenage daughter. She owns a small business selling leather purses in one of the local markets in Melitopol. Marina has been in this business for the last 7 years. Presently, she has about US$ 6000 in inventory. Her gross income is about US$ 2000.

Marina is hoping to continue developing her enterprise and increase her income. She is an experienced entrepreneur who also has a flexible discount system for loyal low-income customers. This time she is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to increase her stock. The already busy markets get even busier as many shoppers get out to buy things for fall. Marina would like to be able to maintain an adequate product inventory during this time so that this will be a profitable season for her and her small business.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Mrs. Kem Ny Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank, located in Chrouy Dang Village, consists of 22 people led by Village Bank President Mrs. Kem N., a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetable seeds to grow in her field. Her husband, Mr. Em Muon, is a construction worker whose small income helps to support the family.

Kem has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. The remaining three are attending the local school. Two of the men shown in the photo are representing their wives who were unavailable due to work commitments.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seeds to grow in her field.
